data/full_data/test/aime_1983_p2.json:
lemma evaluate_at_endpoints:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" and a b :: real
  assumes "a \<le> b"
  shows "min (f a) (f b) = (if f a < f b then f a else f b)"
proof -
  have "min (f a) (f b) = f a \<or> min (f a) (f b) = f b" by (simp add: min_def)
  then show ?thesis
  proof (cases "f a < f b")
    case True
    then show ?thesis by (simp add: min_def)
  next
    case False
    then show ?thesis by (simp add: min_def)
  qed
qed

lemma minimum_value_linear_function:
  fixes a b x :: real
  assumes "a \<le> x" "x \<le> b"
  shows "min (30 - a) (30 - b) = 30 - b"
proof -
  have "30 - a \<ge> 30 - b" using assms by auto
  then have "min (30 - a) (30 - b) = 30 - b" 
    by (simp add: min_def)
  thus ?thesis .
qed

lemma abs_sum_simplification_extended:
  fixes x p :: real
  assumes "x \<ge> p" "x \<le> 15" "0 < p" "p < 15" "x \<le> p + 15"
  shows "abs (x - p) + abs (x - 15) + abs (x - (p + 15)) = 30 - x"
proof -
  have "abs (x - p) = x - p" using assms(1) by auto
  have "abs (x - 15) = 15 - x" using assms(2) by auto
  have "abs (x - (p + 15)) = (p + 15) - x" using assms(5) by auto
  then have "abs (x - p) + abs (x - 15) + abs (x - (p + 15)) = (x - p) + (15 - x) + ((p + 15) - x)" 
    using `abs (x - p) = x - p` and `abs (x - 15) = 15 - x` by auto
  also have "... = x - p + 15 - x + p + 15 - x" by simp
  also have "... = 30 - x" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma algebraic_inequality:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a < b" and "b < c"
  shows "a < c"
proof -
  have "a < b" and "b < c" using assms by auto
  thus ?thesis by (metis less_trans)
qed
data/full_data/test/aime_1989_p8.json:
lemma polynomial_expansion:
  fixes x :: real
  shows "(x + 1)^2 * x = x^3 + 2 * x^2 + x"
proof -
  have "(x + 1)^2 = x^2 + 2 * x + 1" by sos
  then have "(x + 1)^2 * x = (x^2 + 2 * x + 1) * x" by simp
  then have " (x^2 + 2 * x + 1) * x = x^3 + 2 * x^2 + x" by sos
  thus ?thesis by sos
qed

lemma solve_linear_system:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3*a + b = 11" "5*a + b = 111"
  shows "a = 50" "b = -139"
proof -
  have eq1: "3*a + b = 11" using assms(1) by simp
  have eq2: "5*a + b = 111" using assms(2) by simp
  have "5*a + b - (3*a + b) = 111 - 11" using eq1 eq2 by simp
  then have "2*a = 100" by simp
  then have "a = 50" by simp
  have "b = 11 - 3*a" using eq1 by auto
  then have "b = 11 - 3*50" using `a = 50` by simp
  then show "b = -139" by simp
  show "a = 50" by (simp add: `a = 50`)
qed

lemma solve_linear_system:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + b + c = 1" 
      and "4*a + 2*b + c = 12" 
      and "9*a + 3*b + c = 123"
  shows "a = 50" "b = -139" "c = 90"
proof -
  have "c = 1 - a - b" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "4*a + 2*b + (1 - a - b) = 12" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "3*a + b = 11" by simp
  then have "b = 11 - 3*a" by simp
  have "9*a + 3*(11 - 3*a) + (1 - a - (11 - 3*a)) = 123" 
    using assms(3) by (metis \<open>b = 11 - 3 * a\<close> \<open>c = 1 - a - b\<close> dbl_inc_simps(3))
  have "9*a + 33 - 9*a + 1 - a - 11 + 3*a = 123" 
    by (smt (verit) \<open>9 * a + 3 * (11 - 3 * a) + (1 - a - (11 - 3 * a)) = 123\<close>)
  have "33 - 11 + 1 + 2*a = 123" by (smt (verit) \<open>9 * a + 3 * (11 - 3 * a) + (1 - a - (11 - 3 * a)) = 123\<close>)
  then have "23 + 2*a = 123" by simp
  then have "2*a = 100" by simp
  then have "a = 50" by simp
  have "b = 11 - 3*50" by (metis \<open>a = 50\<close> \<open>b = 11 - 3 * a\<close>)
  then have "b = 11 - 150" by simp
  then have "b = -139" by simp
  have "c = 1 - a - b" by (metis \<open>c = 1 - a - b\<close>)
  then have "c = 1 - 50 - (-139)" by (metis \<open>a = 50\<close> \<open>b = -139\<close>)
  then have "c = 1 - 50 + 139" by simp
  then have "c = 90" by simp
  show "a = 50" by (simp add: `a = 50`)
  show "b = -139" by (simp add: `b = -139`)
  show "c = 90" by (simp add: `c = 90`)
qed

lemma polynomial_expansion:
  fixes x :: real
  shows "(x - 2) * (x - 3) = x^2 - 5 * x + 6"
proof -
  have "((x - 2) * (x - 3)) = x*x - 3*x - 2*x + 6" by sos
  thus ?thesis by sos
qed

lemma isolate_variable:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "k1 * a + k2 * b + k3 * c = d1"
      and "k1 * a + k2' * b + k3 * c = d2"
  shows "(k2 - k2') * b = d1 - d2"
proof -
  have "k1 * a + k2 * b + k3 * c - (k1 * a + k2' * b + k3 * c) = d1 - d2"
    using assms by (simp)
  show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>k1 * a + k2 * b + k3 * c - (k1 * a + k2' * b + k3 * c) = d1 - d2\<close> add_diff_add left_diff_distrib')
qed

lemma multi_distrib_complex:
  fixes a b c d :: complex
  shows "(a + b) * (c + d) = a * c + a * d + b * c + b * d"
  by (simp add: distrib_left distrib_right)

lemma isolate_variable:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "k * a + b = d" "k > 0"
  shows "a = (d - b) / k"
proof -
  have "k * a = d - b" using assms by simp
  thus ?thesis by (metis assms(2) frac_eq_eq less_numeral_extra(3) mult.commute nonzero_mult_div_cancel_left)
qed

lemma substitute_variable:
  fixes x y z w :: real
  assumes "y = w + 3 * z" 
  shows "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10 \<Longrightarrow> 3 * x + 4 * w = 10"
     and "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4 \<Longrightarrow> -2 * x - 3 * w = -4"
proof -
  show "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10 \<Longrightarrow> 3 * x + 4 * w = 10"
  proof -
    assume h1: "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10"
    have "4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 4 * w + 12 * z - 12 * z" by simp
    thus "3 * x + 4 * w = 10" using h1 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  qed
  show "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4 \<Longrightarrow> -2 * x - 3 * w = -4"
  proof -
    assume h2: "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4"
    have "-3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -3 * w - 9 * z + 9 * z" by simp
    thus "-2 * x - 3 * w = -4" using h2 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  qed
qed
data/full_data/test/algebra_sqineq_at2ma:
lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

lemma factorization_trick:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a * b + a + b = c"
  shows "(a + 1) * (b + 1) = c + 1"
proof -
  have "a * b + a + b = c" using assms by simp
  then have "(a + 1) * (b + 1) = a * b + a + b + 1" by sos
  then show ?thesis by (metis assms mult_delta_right)
qed

lemma add_to_inequality:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "a \<le> b" and "c \<le> d"
  shows "a + c \<le> b + d"
proof -
  have "a + c - (b + d) = (a - b) + (c - d)"
  proof -
    have "a + c - (b + d) = a - b + c - d" by simp
    thus ?thesis by simp
  qed
  then have "a + c - (b + d) \<le> 0" using assms by linarith
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma sqrt_factorization:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "sqrt (a * b) = sqrt a * sqrt b"
  by (metis real_sqrt_mult)

lemma abs_diff_square:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "abs (a - b) = sqrt ((a - b) ^ 2)"
proof -
  have "abs (a - b) = (if a - b < 0 then -(a - b) else a - b)" 
    by auto
  moreover have "sqrt ((a - b) ^ 2) = (if a - b < 0 then -(a - b) else a - b)"
    by auto
  ultimately show ?thesis 
    by auto
qed

lemma cauchy_schwarz:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a^2 + b^2 = 1"
  shows "a * b \<le> 1 / 2"
proof -
  have "a^2 + b^2 = 1" using assms by simp
  then have "1 = a^2 + b^2" by simp
  have "a^2 + b^2 \<ge> 2 * (a * b)" by sos
  then have "1 \<ge> 2 * (a * b)" using `a^2 + b^2 = 1` by simp
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma smallest_multiple:
  fixes n m :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "m > 0"
  shows "\<exists>k. k * n \<ge> m"
proof -
  have "m div n + 1 > 0" using assms by auto
  then obtain k where "k = m div n + 1" by auto
  have "k * n = (m div n + 1) * n" by (metis `k = m div n + 1`)
  also have "... = (m div n) * n + n" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... \<ge> m" using assms by (metis add.commute dividend_less_times_div le_eq_less_or_eq mult.commute)
  finally show ?thesis using `k = m div n + 1` by blast
qed

lemma inequality_rearrangement:
  fixes m n :: nat
  shows "m * n <= m + n \<longleftrightarrow> m * (n - 1) <= n"
proof -
  have "m * n <= m + n \<longleftrightarrow> m * n - m - n <= 0" by simp
  thus ?thesis by (smt (verit) diff_mult_distrib2 le_add1 le_add_same_cancel1 le_diff_conv minus_nat.diff_0 nat_mult_1_right ordered_cancel_comm_monoid_diff_class.add_diff_inverse)
qed

lemma smallest_multiple:
  fixes n m :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "m > 0"
  shows "\<exists>k. k * n \<ge> m"
proof -
  have "m div n + 1 > 0" using assms by auto
  then obtain k where "k = m div n + 1" by auto
  have "k * n = (m div n + 1) * n"
    by (metis \<open>k = m div n + 1\<close>)
  also have "... = (m div n) * n + n" by auto
  also have "... \<ge> m" using assms by (metis add.commute dividend_less_times_div le_eq_less_or_eq mult.commute)
  finally show ?thesis using `k = m div n + 1` by blast
qed

lemma existence_of_n:
  fixes m :: nat
  shows "\<exists> n > 0. m * n \<le> m + n"
proof -
  show "\<exists> n > 0. m * n \<le> m + n"
  proof (cases "m = 0")
    case True
    then have "0 * n \<le> 0 + n" for n :: nat
      by auto
    then show ?thesis
      by auto
  next
    case False
    then have "m > 0" by simp
    let ?n = "1"
    have "m * ?n = m" "m + ?n = m + 1" "m * ?n \<le> m + ?n"
      by (simp_all add: algebra_simps)
    thus ?thesis
      by (metis One_nat_def less_numeral_extra(1) le_add_diff_inverse nat_less_le)
  qed
qed
data/full_data/test/amc12a_2009_p6.json:
lemma mod_power:
  fixes a :: nat and n :: nat and m :: nat
  shows "(a^n) mod m = (a mod m)^n mod m"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then show ?case
  proof -
    have "a^(Suc n) = a * a^n" by simp
    then have "(a^(Suc n)) mod m = (a * a^n) mod m" by simp
    also have "... = ((a mod m) * (a^n mod m)) mod m"
      by (metis mod_mult_eq)
    also have "... = ((a mod m) * ((a mod m)^n mod m)) mod m"
      using Suc.IH by simp
    also have "... = ((a mod m)^(Suc n)) mod m"
      by (metis calculation power_mod)
    finally show ?case by simp
  qed
qed

lemma power_of_exponent:
  fixes x :: real and n m :: nat
  assumes "x > 0"
  shows "x^n * x^m = x^(n + m)"
proof -
  have "x^n * x^m = exp (ln (x^n) + ln (x^m))"
    by (metis add.commute assms exp_ln ln_mult mult.commute power_add zero_less_power)
  also have "... = exp (n * ln x + m * ln x)"
    by (metis add.commute assms calculation exp_ln exp_of_nat2_mult mult.commute of_nat_add power_add ring_class.ring_distribs(2))
  also have "... = exp ((n + m) * ln x)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by (metis power_add)
qed

lemma product_relation:
  fixes m n :: nat
  assumes "gcd m n = 6" and "lcm m n = 126"
  shows "m * n = 756"
proof -
  let ?g = "gcd m n"
  let ?l = "lcm m n"
  have "m * n = ?g * ?l" using assms by (metis prod_gcd_lcm_nat)
  also have "... = 6 * 126" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 756" by simp
  finally show "m * n = 756" .
qed

lemma power_of_exponent:
  fixes x :: real and n m :: nat
  assumes "x > 0"
  shows "x^n * x^m = x^(n + m)"
proof -
  have "x^n * x^m = x^(n + m)"
  proof (induction n)
    case 0
    then show ?case by simp
  next
    case (Suc n)
    then show ?case
    proof -
      have "x^(Suc n) * x^m = x^(n + 1) * x^m" by simp
      also have "... = x^n * x^m * x" by (simp add: power_add)
      also have "... = x^(n + m) * x" using Suc.IH by simp
      also have "... = x^(n + m + 1)" by (simp add: power_add)
      finally show ?case by simp
    qed
  qed
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed
data/full_data/test/amc12a_2021_p3.json:
lemma sum_divisible:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes "x + y = 17402" "10 dvd x" "x div 10 = y"
  shows "x - y = 9 * (x div 10)"
proof -
  from assms(2) obtain k where "x = 10 * k" by (auto simp: dvd_def)
  then have "x div 10 = k" by (simp add: div_mult_self2)
  have "y = x div 10" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "x = 10 * y" by (metis assms(2) assms(3) dvdI dvd_div_eq_1 mult.commute nonzero_mult_div_cancel_right zero_neq_numeral)
  have "x - y = (10 * y) - y" using `x = 10 * y` by simp
  thus "x - y = 9 * (x div 10)" using `x div 10 = y` by simp
qed

lemma sum_of_numbers:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes "x + y = s" "10 dvd x" "x div 10 = y"
  shows "s = 11 * y"
proof -
  from assms(2) obtain k where "x = 10 * k" by (auto simp: dvd_def)
  then have "x div 10 = k" by (simp add: div_mult_self2)
  hence "y = k" using assms(3) by simp
  have "s = x + y" using assms(1) by simp
  also have "... = (10 * k) + k" using `x = 10 * k` by (metis \<open>y = k\<close> semiring_norm(3))
  finally have "s = 11 * k" by simp
  thus "s = 11 * y" using `y = k` by simp
qed

lemma sum_divisible:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes "x + y = 17402" "10 dvd x" "x div 10 = y"
  shows "x - y = 9 * (x div 10)"
proof -
  from assms(2) obtain k where "x = 10 * k" by (auto simp: dvd_def)
  then have "x div 10 = k" by (simp add: div_mult_self2)
  hence "y = k" using assms(3) by simp
  have "x - y = (10 * k) - k" 
    using `x = 10 * k` by (metis \<open>y = k\<close> semiring_norm(3))
  thus "x - y = 9 * (x div 10)" 
    using `x div 10 = k` by simp
qed

lemma difference_of_numbers:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes "x = 10 * y"
  shows "x - y = 9 * y"
proof -
  have "x - y = (10 * y) - y" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 9 * y" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

definition f :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat" where
  "f x = 4^x + 6^x + 9^x"

lemma f_12k_plus_9:
  fixes k :: nat
  shows "f (12 * k + 9) = 4^(12 * k + 9) + 6^(12 * k + 9) + 9^(12 * k + 9)"
proof -
  have "f (12 * k + 9) = 4^(12 * k + 9) + 6^(12 * k + 9) + 9^(12 * k + 9)" 
    by (simp add: f_def)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma power_computation:
  fixes k :: nat
  shows "k^12 = (k^6)^2"
proof -
  have "k^12 = k^(6 + 6)" by simp
  also have "... = k^6 * k^6" by (simp add: power_add)
  also have "... = (k^6)^2" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma sum_of_powers:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(\<Prod> k < n. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k))) = (3::nat)^(2^n) - 2^(2^n)"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case 
    by auto
next
  case (Suc n)
  then have IH: "(\<Prod> k < n. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k))) = (3::nat)^(2^n) - 2^(2^n)" 
    by simp
  have "(\<Prod> k < Suc n. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k))) = (\<Prod> k < n. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k))) * (2^(2^n) + 3^(2^n))"
    by (simp add: prod.atLeastLessThan_Suc) 
  also have "... = ((3::nat)^(2^n) - 2^(2^n)) * (2^(2^n) + 3^(2^n))" 
    using IH by simp
  also have "... = (3^(2^n) * 3^(2^n)) - (2^(2^n) * 2^(2^n))" 
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 3^(2^(Suc n)) - 2^(2^(Suc n))" 
    by (metis power2_eq_square power_Suc power_even_eq semiring_norm(3))
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

lemma power_computation:
  fixes k :: nat
  shows "k^12 = (k^6)^2"
proof -
  have "k^12 = k^(6 + 6)" by simp
  also have "... = (k^6)^2" by (simp add: power_add)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma combine_terms:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  shows "a * (b - c) + d = (a * b) - (a * c) + d"
  by (simp add: algebra_simps)

lemma substitution:
  fixes x :: int
  assumes "x = 4"
  shows "3 * x - 1 = 11"
proof -
  have "3 * x = 3 * 4" using assms by simp
  then have "3 * x - 1 = 12 - 1" by simp
  thus "3 * x - 1 = 11" by simp
qed

lemma substitute_x_zero:
  fixes f :: "int \<Rightarrow> int"
  assumes "\<forall>a b. f(2 * a) + 2 * f(b) = f(f(a + b))"
  shows "f(0) + 2 * f(b) = f(f(b))"
proof -
  have "f(2 * x) + 2 * f(b) = f(f(x + b))" for x :: int using assms by blast
  then have "f(2 * 0) + 2 * f(b) = f(f(0 + b))" by blast
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma distributive_property:
  fixes a b c :: int
  shows "a * (b + c) = a * b + a * c"
proof -
  have "a * (b + c) = a * b + a * c"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  thus ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma factorial_difference:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) = (n + 1) * fact (n + 1)"
proof -
  have "fact (n + 2) = (n + 2) * fact (n + 1)" 
    by (simp add: fact_Suc)
  then have "fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1) = (n + 2) * fact (n + 1) - fact (n + 1)"
    by simp
  also have "... = (n + 1) * fact (n + 1) + fact (n + 1) - fact (n + 1)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis 
    by simp
qed

lemma algebraic_identity:
  fixes a b c :: real
  shows "(a + b)^2 = a^2 + 2*a*b + b^2" 
  and "(a - b)^2 = a^2 - 2*a*b + b^2"
proof -
  have "(a + b)^2 = a^2 + 2*a*b + b^2" 
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  then show "(a + b)^2 = a^2 + 2*a*b + b^2" by simp
  have "(a - b)^2 = a^2 - 2*a*b + b^2" 
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  then show "(a - b)^2 = a^2 - 2*a*b + b^2" by simp
qed

lemma perfect_square:
  fixes x :: nat
  shows "\<exists>y. (real_of_nat y)^2 = x^2"
proof -
  obtain y where "y = x" by (metis nat.exhaust)
  have "(real_of_nat y)^2 = (real_of_nat x)^2" by (simp add: `y = x`)
  thus ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma perfect_square:
  fixes x :: nat
  shows "\<exists>y. (real_of_nat y)^2 = x^2"
proof -
  obtain y where "y = x" by auto
  hence "(real_of_nat y)^2 = (real_of_nat x)^2" by auto
  thus "\<exists>y. (real_of_nat y)^2 = x^2" by auto
qed

data/full_data/test/induction_1pxpownlt1:
lemma induction_step:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  assumes "1 + n * x \<le> (1 + x)^n"
  shows "1 + (n + 1) * x \<le> (1 + x)^(n + 1)"
proof -
  have "1 + (n + 1) * x = 1 + n * x + x" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = (1 + n * x) + x" by simp
  finally have "1 + (n + 1) * x = (1 + n * x) + x" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "(1 + x)^(n + 1) = (1 + x) * (1 + x)^n" by (simp add: power_Suc)
  from assms have "1 + n * x \<le> (1 + x)^n" by auto
  thus "1 + (n + 1) * x \<le> (1 + x)^(n + 1)"
    using `1 + (n + 1) * x = (1 + n * x) + x` by (smt (verit) Bernoulli_inequality assms(1) less_eq_real_def)
qed

lemma base_case_generalization:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "-1 < x" "x > 0"
  shows "1 \<le> (1 + x)^0" 
     and "1 + x \<le> (1 + x)^1"
proof -
  have "(1 + x)^0 = 1" by simp
  thus "1 \<le> (1 + x)^0" by simp
  have "(1 + x)^1 = 1 + x" by simp
  thus "1 + x \<le> (1 + x)^1" by simp
qed

lemma base_case_n1_generalized:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(1 + n * x) \<le> (1 + x)^n"
proof -
  have "1 + n * x = 1 + n * x" by simp
  have "(1 + x)^n = (1 + x)^n" by simp
  thus ?thesis by (smt (verit) Bernoulli_inequality assms less_eq_real_def)
qed

lemma induction_step:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  assumes "1 + n * x \<le> (1 + x)^n"
  shows "1 + (n + 1) * x \<le> (1 + x)^(n + 1)"
proof -
  have "1 + (n + 1) * x = 1 + n * x + x" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = (1 + n * x) + x" by simp
  finally have "1 + (n + 1) * x = (1 + n * x) + x" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "(1 + x)^(n + 1) = (1 + x) * (1 + x)^n" by (simp add: power_Suc)
  from assms have "1 + n * x \<le> (1 + x)^n" by auto
  have "(1 + x) > 0" using assms by auto
  hence "(1 + x) * (1 + n * x) \<le> (1 + x) * (1 + x)^n" using `1 + n * x \<le> (1 + x)^n` by (simp add: mult_left_mono)
  also have "... = (1 + x)^(n + 1)" by (simp add: power_Suc)
  finally have "1 + (n + 1) * x \<le> (1 + x)^(n + 1)" using `1 + (n + 1) * x = (1 + n * x) + x` by (smt (verit) Bernoulli_inequality \<open>0 < 1 + x\<close> less_eq_real_def real_0_le_add_iff)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_general:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x + b"  
    and "\<forall> x. g x = c * x + d"  
  shows "g (f x - k) = c * (a * x + b - k) + d"
proof -
  have "f x = a * x + b" using assms(1) by auto
  hence "f x - k = (a * x + b) - k" by simp
  then show "g (f x - k) = c * (a * x + b - k) + d" using assms(2) by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_general:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x + b"  
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x + c"        
  shows "g (f d - e) = f d + c - e"   
proof -
  have "f d = a * d + b" using assms(1) by auto
  then have "f d - e = (a * d + b) - e" by simp
  then have "g (f d - e) = g ((a * d + b) - e)" by simp
  also have "... = ((a * d + b) - e) + c" using assms(2) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>f d = a * d + b\<close> \<open>g (a * d + b - e) = a * d + b - e + c\<close> \<open>g (f d - e) = g (a * d + b - e)\<close>)
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"
proof -
  have "(x + b)^c mod n = ((x mod n) + b)^c mod n"
    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"
    using assms(4) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma cube_identity:
  fixes x :: real
  shows "(x + 1/x)^3 = x^3 + 1/x^3 + 3*(x + 1/x)"
proof -
  have "x + 1/x = x + (1/x)" by simp
  then have "(x + 1/x)^3 = (x + (1/x))^3" by simp
  also have "... = x^3 + 3 * (x^2 * (1/x)) + 3 * (x * (1/x^2)) + (1/x)^3" by sos
  also have "... = x^3 + 3 * x + 3 * (1/x) + (1/x^3)" by sos
  also have "... = x^3 + 1/x^3 + 3 * (x + 1/x)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by sos
qed

theorem substitution_and_simplification:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "y = 3 * x + 1"
  shows "x = 9 - 2 * y \<Longrightarrow> x = 1 \<and> y = 4"
proof -
  assume h1: "x = 9 - 2 * y"
  then have "x = 9 - 2 * (3 * x + 1)" using assms by simp
  then have "x = 9 - 6 * x - 2" by (simp add: assms)
  then have "7 * x = 7" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "x = 1" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "y = 3 * x + 1" by (metis assms)
  then have "y = 3 * 1 + 1" by (metis \<open>x = 1\<close>)
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>x = 1\<close> add.commute assms dbl_inc_simps(3) mult.comm_neutral one_plus_BitM one_plus_numeral semiring_norm(26) semiring_norm(27))
qed

  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_513:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5" and "a + b = 2"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 1"
proof -
  obtain s p where sp: "s = a + b" "p = a * b" using assms by auto
  have "s = 2" using sp(1) by (metis assms(2) diff_minus_eq_add of_nat_numeral)
  have "3 * a + 2 * (2 - a) = 5" using sp(1) by (metis \<open>s = 2\<close> add_diff_cancel_left' assms(1) dbl_def dbl_inc_simps(3) dbl_inc_simps(5) mult.commute mult_2)
  then have "3 * a + 4 - 2 * a = 5" by simp
  then have "a = 1" by simp
  then have "b = 2 - a" using sp(1) by (metis add_diff_cancel_left' assms(2) uminus_add_conv_diff)
  then show "a = 1 \<and> b = 1" using \<open>a = 1\<close> by simp
qed

lemma solve_linear_equations:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x + y = a" 
    and "x - y = b"
  shows "x = (a + b) / 2"
  and "y = (a - b) / 2"
proof -
  have "x + y + (x - y) = a + b" using assms by auto
  then have "2 * x = a + b" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show "x = (a + b) / 2" by (simp)
  have "x + y - (x - y) = a - b" using assms by auto
  then have "2 * y = a - b" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show "y = (a - b) / 2" by (simp)
qed

lemma solve_linear_equations:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x + y = a" and "x - y = b" 
  shows "x = (a + b) / 2" and "y = (a - b) / 2"
proof -
  have "x + y + (x - y) = a + b" using assms by auto
  then have "2 * x = a + b" by simp
  thus "x = (a + b) / 2" by simp
  have "x + y - (x - y) = a - b" using assms by auto
  then have "2 * y = a - b" by simp
  thus "y = (a - b) / 2" by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_generalized:

  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = m * x + b" and "\<forall> x. g x = n * x + c"
  shows "g (f x - d) = n * (m * x + b - d) + c"
proof -
  have "f x = m * x + b" using assms(1) by auto
  then have "f x - d = (m * x + b) - d" by simp
  then have "g (f x - d) = g ((m * x + b) - d)" by simp
  also have "... = n * ((m * x + b) - d) + c" using assms(2) by auto
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

  have "g (f 5 - 1) = g 6" by (metis \<open>f 5 - 1 = 7 - 1\<close> diff_numeral_special(2) sub_num_simps(5))
  then have "g 6 = 6 + 1" using assms(2) by auto
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>f 5 = 7\<close> assms(1) assms(2) cancel_ab_semigroup_add_class.diff_right_commute diff_add_eq diff_minus_eq_add eq_diff_eq)

theorem mathd_algebra_171_extended:

lemma polynomial_expansion:
  fixes x :: real
  shows "(x + c)^2 * x = x^3 + 2 * c * x^2 + c^2 * x"
proof -
  have expansion: "(x + c)^2 = (x + c) * (x + c)"
    by sos
  have expanded: "(x + c) * (x + c) = x * x + x * c + c * x + c * c"
    by sos
  then have "(x + c)^2 = x^2 + 2 * c * x + c^2"
    by sos
  have "(x + c)^2 * x = (x^2 + 2 * c * x + c^2) * x"
    using expansion by sos
  have " (x^2 + 2 * c * x + c^2) * x = x^2 * x + 2 * c * x * x + c^2 * x"
    by sos
  then have " (x^2 + 2 * c * x + c^2) * x = x^3 + 2 * c * x^2 + c^2 * x"
    by sos
  thus ?thesis by sos
qed

lemma f_value_at_2:

lemma floor_10N:
  fixes n :: real
  assumes "n = 1 / 3"
  shows "floor (10 * n) = 3"
proof -
  have "10 * n = 10 * (1 / 3)" using assms by simp
  then have "10 * n = 10 / 3" by simp
  also have "... = 3 + 1 / 3" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "10 * n < 4" by (smt (verit) assms calculation)
  have "3 \<le> 10 * n" using `10 * n = 10 / 3` by simp
  thus "floor (10 * n) = 3" using `3 \<le> 10 * n` `10 * n < 4` 
    by arith
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_143_extended:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = x + 1"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x^2 + 3" 
  shows "\<forall>y. f (g y) = y^2 + 4"
proof -
  have g_eval: "g y = y^2 + 3" for y using assms(2) by auto
  then have g_eval_result: "g y = y^2 + 3" by simp
  then have g_result: "f (g y) = f (y^2 + 3)" for y by (metis assms(1) g_eval)
  also have "f (y^2 + 3) = (y^2 + 3) + 1" using assms(1) by auto
  finally have "f (g y) = y^2 + 3 + 1" for y by (metis assms(1) g_eval)
  thus ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_107:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x^2 + 8 * x + y^2 - 6 * y = 0" 
  shows "(x + 4)^2 + (y-3)^2 = 5^2"
proof -
  have x_square: "(x^2 + 8 * x) = (x + 4)^2 - 16" 
    by sos
  have y_square: "(y^2 - 6 * y) = (y - 3)^2 - 9" 
    by sos
  have equation: "(x + 4)^2 - 16 + (y - 3)^2 - 9 = 0" 
    using x_square y_square assms by simp
  have simplified: "(x + 4)^2 + (y - 3)^2 = 25" 
    using equation by simp
  show ?thesis 
    using simplified by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_171_extended:

  proof (rule allI)
    fix y
    have "f y = 5 * y + 4" using assms by auto
    thus "f y = 5 * y + 4" by simp
  qed
qed

lemma linear_combination:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + b = c"
  shows "b = c - a"
proof -
  have "c - a + a = c" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by (metis add.commute add_cancel_left_right assms crossproduct_eq diff_add_eq_diff_diff_swap diff_eq_diff_eq eq_iff_diff_eq_0 minus_diff_eq mult.commute mult_cancel_right2 mult_eq_0_iff mult_minus_right neg_0_equal_iff_equal zero_neq_neg_one)
qed

lemma linear_system_solution:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "m * a + n * b = c"
    and "p * a + q * b = d"
    and "m \<noteq> 0"
    and "n \<noteq> 0"
  shows "a = (c - n * b) / m"
proof -
  have "m * a = c - n * b" using assms(1) by simp
  then show ?thesis by (metis assms(3) mult.commute nonzero_mult_div_cancel_right)
qed

lemma solve_linear_system:
  fixes m b x y :: real
  assumes "m * x + b = c" and "m * y + b = d"
  shows "m * (x + y) + 2 * b = c + d"
proof -
  have "b = c - m * x" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "m * y + (c - m * x) = d" using assms(2) by (metis)
  then have "m * y = d - c + m * x" by simp
  then have "m * (x + y) + 2 * (c - m * x) = c + d"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  thus ?thesis by (metis \<open>b = c - m * x\<close> dbl_simps(3))
qed

theorem linear_combination:
  fixes a b c x y :: real
  assumes "a + b = c" "a - b = x"
  shows "a = (c + x) / 2" and "b = (c - x) / 2"
proof -
  have "a + b + (a - b) = c + x" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "2 * a = c + x" by simp
  thus "a = (c + x) / 2" using field_simps by simp
  have "a - b = x" by (simp add: assms(2))
  then have "b = a - x" using `a = (c + x) / 2` by fastforce
  thus "b = (c - x) / 2" using `a = (c + x) / 2` by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_513:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5" and "a + b = 2"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 1"
proof -
  obtain s p where sp: "s = a + b" "p = a * b" using assms by auto
  have "s = 2" using sp(1) by (metis assms(2) diff_minus_eq_add of_nat_numeral)
  have "3 * a + 2 * (2 - a) = 5" using sp(1) by (metis \<open>s = 2\<close> add_diff_cancel_left' assms(1) dbl_def dbl_inc_simps(3) dbl_inc_simps(5) mult.commute mult_2)
  then have "3 * a + 4 - 2 * a = 5" by simp
  then have "a = 1" by simp
  then have "b = 2 - a" using sp(1) by (metis add_diff_cancel_left' assms(2) uminus_add_conv_diff)
  then show "a = 1 \<and> b = 1" using \<open>a = 1\<close> by simp
qed

lemma sqrt_inequality:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x > 0" "y > 0"
  shows "sqrt x < sqrt y \<longleftrightarrow> x < y"
proof
  assume "sqrt x < sqrt y"
  then have "sqrt x ^ 2 < sqrt y ^ 2" by (metis assms(1) less_eq_real_def pos2 power_strict_mono real_sqrt_ge_zero)
  thus "x < y" by (metis \<open>sqrt x < sqrt y\<close> real_sqrt_less_iff)
next
  assume "x < y"
  then have "x - y < 0" by simp
  thus "sqrt x < sqrt y" by auto
qed

lemma sqrt_property:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "0 \<le> x" and "0 \<le> y"
  shows "sqrt (x * y) = sqrt x * sqrt y"
proof -

    using assms(1) assms(2) by (metis real_sqrt_mult)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma isolate_sqrt:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "sqrt x = y" and "y >= 0"
  shows "x = y^2"
proof -
  have "y^2 >= 0" using assms(2) by auto
  have "x = (sqrt x)^2" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2) real_sqrt_ge_0_iff real_sqrt_pow2)
  also have "... = y^2" using assms(1) by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

  finally show ?thesis by auto

lemma cancle_div_multi:
  fixes x :: real
  and a b c :: "real list"
  assumes "x > 0" "length a = length b" "length a = length c" 
    and "\<forall>i. a ! i + b ! i / x = c ! i" 
  shows "\<forall>i. a ! i * x + b ! i = c ! i * x"
proof -

    using assms(4) by auto
  then have "\<forall>i. x * a ! i + x * (b ! i / x) = c ! i * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

  then have "b^2 = 9" by simp

lemma geometric_sequence_property:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "0 < a" "0 < b"
  shows "a^2 = 6 * b \<Longrightarrow> a^2 = 54 / b \<Longrightarrow> 6 * b = 54 / b"
proof -
  assume h1: "a^2 = 6 * b"
  assume h2: "a^2 = 54 / b"
  have "6 * b = 54 / b" 
  proof -
    from h1 have "a^2 = 6 * b" by (simp add: h1)
    from h2 have "6 * b = 54 / b" 
      by (metis h1)
    thus ?thesis by simp
  qed
  thus ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma substitution_with_constant:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "x^2 - 10 * x - a = 0"
  shows "x^2 - 10 * x - (a + b) = -b"
     and "x^2 - 10 * x - (a - b) = b"
proof -
  have "x^2 - 10 * x - (a + b) = (x^2 - 10 * x - a) - b" 
    using assms by simp
  thus "x^2 - 10 * x - (a + b) = -b" by (metis assms one_add_one verit_minus_simplify(3))
  have "x^2 - 10 * x - (a - b) = (x^2 - 10 * x - a) + b" 
    using assms by simp
  thus "x^2 - 10 * x - (a - b) = b" by (metis assms comm_monoid_add_class.add_0 one_add_one)
qed

lemma polynomial_substitution:

  shows "x^2 - 10 * x - (a + 16) = b - 16" 
     and "x^2 - 10 * x - (a + 40) = b - 40"
proof -
  have "x^2 - 10 * x - (a + 16) = (x^2 - 10 * x - a) - 16" 
    using assms by simp
  thus "x^2 - 10 * x - (a + 16) = b - 16" by (metis assms)
  have "x^2 - 10 * x - (a + 40) = (x^2 - 10 * x - a) - 40" 
    using assms by simp
  thus "x^2 - 10 * x - (a + 40) = b - 40" by (metis assms)
qed

  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + 2"
  shows "f (-3) = a * 81 - b * 9 + 2"
proof -

  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_general:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x + b"  
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x + c"        
  shows "g (f d - e) = f d + c - e"   
proof -
  have "f d = a * d + b" using assms(1) by auto
  then have "f d - e = (a * d + b) - e" by simp
  then have "g (f d - e) = g ((a * d + b) - e)" by simp
  also have "... = ((a * d + b) - e) + c" using assms(2) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>f d = a * d + b\<close> \<open>g (a * d + b - e) = a * d + b - e + c\<close> \<open>g (f d - e) = g (a * d + b - e)\<close>)
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

lemma fraction_exponent_property:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(a / b)^2 = a^2 / b^2"
proof -
  have "(a / b)^2 = (a * (1 / b))^2" by simp
  also have "... = a^2 * (1 / b)^2" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = a^2 / (b^2)" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

  shows "(a / b)^2 = a^2 / b^2"

  also have "... = a^2 * (1 / b)^2" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)

qed

lemma f_of_f1:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x \<noteq> -2. f x = 1 / (x + 2)"
  shows "f (f 1) = 3 / 7"
proof -
  have "f 1 = 1 / (1 + 2)" using assms by auto
  hence "f 1 = 1 / 3" by simp
  then have "f (f 1) = f (1 / 3)" using assms by (metis)
  have "f (1 / 3) = 1 / (1 / 3 + 2)" using assms by auto
  then have "f (1 / 3) = 1 / (1 / 3 + 6 / 3)" by simp
  then have "f (1 / 3) = 1 / (7 / 3)" by simp
  then have "f (1 / 3) = 3 / 7" by simp
  thus ?thesis by (metis \<open>f (f 1) = f (1 / 3)\<close>)
qed

lemma function_composition:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"

      and "\<forall> x. g x = x + 1"

proof -

  then show ?thesis by (simp add: assms(2))
qed

lemma algebraic_identity:
  fixes a b c :: real
  shows "(a + b)^2 = a^2 + 2*a*b + b^2" 
  and "(a - b)^2 = a^2 - 2*a*b + b^2"
proof -
  have "(a + b)^2 = a^2 + 2*a*b + b^2" 
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  then show "(a + b)^2 = a^2 + 2*a*b + b^2" by simp
  have "(a - b)^2 = a^2 - 2*a*b + b^2" 
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  then show "(a - b)^2 = a^2 - 2*a*b + b^2" by simp
qed

lemma expand_quadratic_complex:

  shows "(-a + -b)^2 = a^2 + 2*a*b + b^2"

    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  also have "... = a^2 + 2 * a * b + b^2"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_412:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x + y = 25"
    and "x - y = 11" 
  shows "x = 18"
proof -
  have "x + y + (x - y) = 25 + 11" using assms by auto
  have "2 * x = 36" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  have "x = 36 / 2" by (metis \<open>2 * x = 36\<close> diff_divide_distrib diff_eq_diff_eq mult.commute mult_2_right real_average_minus_second)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma linear_system_solution:
  fixes x y a b :: real
  assumes "a + b = 25" "a - b = 11"
  shows "a = 18"
proof -
  have "a + b + (a - b) = 25 + 11" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "2 * a = 36" by simp
  thus ?thesis using `2 * a = 36` by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_359:
  fixes y :: real
  assumes "y + 6 + y = 2 * 12" 
  shows "y = 9"
proof -
  have equation: "2 * y + 6 = 2 * 12" using assms by simp
  have "2 * y + 6 = 24" 
    using equation by simp
  have "2 * y = 24 - 6" 
    using `2 * y + 6 = 24` by simp
  have "2 * y = 18" 
    using `2 * y = 24 - 6` by simp
  have "y = 18 / 2" 
    using `2 * y = 18` by auto
  have "y = 9" 
    using `y = 18 / 2` by simp
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma product_of_sums:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  shows "(a + b) * (c + d) = a*c + a*d + b*c + b*d"
proof -

  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma sum_of_equations:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "0 < a" "0 < b" "0 < c"
    and "a * (b + c) = 152"
    and "b * (c + a) = 162"
    and "c * (a + b) = 170"
  shows "a * b + b * c + c * a = 242"
proof -
  have "a * b + b * c + c * a = (a * (b + c) + b * (c + a) + c * (a + b)) / 2"
    by sos
  then have "a * b + b * c + c * a = (152 + 162 + 170) / 2"
    using assms by simp
  then have "a * b + b * c + c * a = (484) / 2"
    by simp
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

  then show ?thesis by (metis assms(2))
qed

lemma isolate_c:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + b + 3 * c = 19"
      and "a + b + c = 5"
  shows "c = 7"
proof -
  have "a + b + 3 * c - (a + b + c) = 19 - 5"
    using assms by (simp)
  have "2 * c = 14" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * c = 14\<close>)
qed

lemma isolate_b:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
      and "a + b + c = 5"
  shows "b = 2"
proof -
  have "a + 3 * b + c - (a + b + c) = 9 - 5"
    using assms by (simp)
  have "2 * b = 4" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * b = 4\<close>)
qed

lemma isolate_a:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
      and "a + b + c = 5"
  shows "a = -4"
proof -
  have "3 * a + b + c - (a + b + c) = -3 - 5"
    using assms by (simp)
  have "2 * a = -8" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * a = - 8\<close>)
qed

lemma linear_equations_sum:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
      and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
      and "a + b + 3 * c = 19"
  shows "a + b + c = 5"
proof -
  have "3 * a + b + c + a + 3 * b + c + a + b + 3 * c = -3 + 9 + 19"
    using assms by simp
  have "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2) assms(3))
  have "a + b + c = 5" by (smt (verit) \<open>5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25\<close>)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_338:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and "a + b + 3 * c = 19" 
  shows "a * b * c = -56"
proof -
  have "a + b + c = 5" using linear_equations_sum assms by simp
  have a_val: "a = -4" using isolate_a assms by simp
  have b_val: "b = 2" using isolate_b assms by simp
  have c_val: "c = 7" using isolate_c assms by simp
  have "a * b * c = (-4) * 2 * 7"
    using a_val b_val c_val by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma arithmetic_sequence_general:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "b - a = c - b" and "d - c = c - b"
  shows "2 * b = a + c" and "2 * c = b + d"
proof -
  from assms(1) have "a + c = 2 * b" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  moreover from assms(2) have "b + d = 2 * c" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  ultimately show "2 * b = a + c" and "2 * c = b + d" by simp_all
qed

lemma solve_linear_equations:
  fixes a d :: real
  assumes "a + 6 * d = 30" and "a + 10 * d = 60"
  shows "d = 15 / 2"
proof -
  have "a + 10 * d - (a + 6 * d) = 60 - 30" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "4 * d = 30" by simp
  then show "d = 15 / 2" by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_263_evolved:
  fixes y :: real
  assumes "0 \<le> 19 + 3 * y"
    and "sqrt (19 + 3 * y) = 7" 
  shows "y = 10"
proof -
  have "19 + 3 * y = 7^2" using assms(2) by (smt (verit) assms(1) real_sqrt_pow2_iff)
  then have "19 + 3 * y = 49" by simp
  then have "3 * y = 49 - 19" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "3 * y = 30" by simp
  then show "y = 10" by (simp add: divide_simps)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_263:
  fixes y :: real
  assumes "0 \<le> 19 + 3 * y"
    and "sqrt (19 + 3 * y) = 7" 
  shows "y = 10"
proof -
  have "19 + 3 * y = 7^2" using assms(2) by (smt (verit) assms(1) real_sqrt_pow2_iff)
  have "19 + 3 * y = 49" by (metis \<open>19 + 3 * y = 7\<^sup>2\<close> add_One_commute mult.commute numeral_Bit0 numeral_eq_iff numeral_plus_numeral numeral_times_numeral power2_eq_square semiring_norm(10) semiring_norm(12) semiring_norm(16) semiring_norm(2) semiring_norm(3) semiring_norm(4) semiring_norm(6))
  have "3 * y = 49 - 19" by (smt (verit) \<open>19 + 3 * y = 49\<close>)
  have "3 * y = 30" by (smt (verit) \<open>3 * y = 49 - 19\<close>)
  have "y = 30 / 3" by (metis \<open>3 * y = 30\<close> mult.commute nonzero_mult_div_cancel_right zero_neq_numeral)
  have "y = 10" by (smt (verit) \<open>3 * y = 30\<close>)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_107:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x^2 + 8 * x + y^2 - 6 * y = 0" 
  shows "(x + 4)^2 + (y-3)^2 = 5^2"
proof -
  have x_square: "(x^2 + 8 * x) = (x + 4)^2 - 16" 
    by sos
  have y_square: "(y^2 - 6 * y) = (y - 3)^2 - 9" 
    by sos
  have equation: "(x + 4)^2 - 16 + (y - 3)^2 - 9 = 0" 
    using x_square y_square assms by simp
  have simplified: "(x + 4)^2 + (y - 3)^2 = 25" 
    using equation by simp
  show ?thesis 
    using simplified by simp
qed

lemma substitute_variable:

  assumes "y = w + 3 * z"
  shows "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10 \<Longrightarrow> 3 * x + 4 * w = 10"
  and "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4 \<Longrightarrow> -2 * x - 3 * w = -4"
proof -
  show "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10 \<Longrightarrow> 3 * x + 4 * w = 10"
  proof -
    assume h1: "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10"
    have "3 * x + 4 * w + 12 * z - 12 * z = 10" by (smt (verit) h1)
    thus "3 * x + 4 * w = 10" by (simp add: add_cancel_right_left)
  qed
  show "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4 \<Longrightarrow> -2 * x - 3 * w = -4"
  proof -
    assume h2: "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4"
    have "-2 * x - 3 * w - 9 * z + 9 * z = -4" by (smt (verit) h2)
    thus "-2 * x - 3 * w = -4" by (simp add: add_cancel_right_left)
  qed
qed

lemma linear_combination:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x + y = a"
    and "x - y = b"
  shows "x = (a + b) / 2"
proof -
  have "x + y + (x - y) = a + b" using assms by auto
  then have "2 * x = a + b" by auto
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: divide_simps)
qed

lemma linear_combination:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "a * x + b * y + c * z = d" "k * x + m * y + n * z = p"
  shows "(a + k) * x + (b + m) * y + (c + n) * z = d + p"
proof -
  have "a * x + b * y + c * z + k * x + m * y + n * z = d + p"
    using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: algebra_simps)
qed

lemma substitute_variable:
  fixes x y z w :: real
  assumes "y = w + 3 * z" 
  shows "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10 \<Longrightarrow> 3 * x + 4 * w = 10"
     and "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4 \<Longrightarrow> -2 * x - 3 * w = -4"
proof -
  show "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10 \<Longrightarrow> 3 * x + 4 * w = 10"
  proof -
    assume h1: "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10"
    have "4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 4 * w + 12 * z - 12 * z" by simp
    thus "3 * x + 4 * w = 10" using h1 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  qed
  show "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4 \<Longrightarrow> -2 * x - 3 * w = -4"
  proof -
    assume h2: "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4"
    have "-3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -3 * w - 9 * z + 9 * z" by simp
    thus "-2 * x - 3 * w = -4" using h2 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  qed
qed

lemma conversion_lags_to_lugs:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "9 * b = 20 * c"

proof -
  have "b = (20 * c) / 9" using assms by (simp add: field_simps)
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: field_simps)

lemma multiply_equations:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "0 < x" "0 < y" "0 < z"
    and "x + 1/y = 4"
    and "y + 1/z = 1"
    and "z + 1/x = 7/3"
  shows "(x + 1/y) * (y + 1/z) * (z + 1/x) = (4 * 1 * (7/3))"
proof -
  have eq1: "x + 1/y = 4" using assms(3) by (metis assms(4))
  have eq2: "y + 1/z = 1" using assms(4) by (metis assms(5))
  have eq3: "z + 1/x = 7/3" using assms(5) by (metis assms(6))
  have "x + 1/y = 4" by (simp add: eq1)
  have "y + 1/z = 1" by (simp add: eq2)
  have "z + 1/x = 7/3" by (simp add: eq3)
  have " (x + 1/y) * (y + 1/z) * (z + 1/x) 
        = 4 * 1 * (7/3)" 
  proof -
    have " (x + 1/y) * (y + 1/z) = 4 * 1" 
      by (metis eq1 eq2)
    then have " (x + 1/y) * (y + 1/z) * (z + 1/x) 
              = (4 * 1) * (z + 1/x)" 
      by (metis (full_types) eq3)
    also have "... = 4 * (7/3)" 
      by (simp add: eq3)
    finally show ?thesis by simp
  qed
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_398_3d:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c \<and> 0 < d"
    and "9 * b = 20 * c"
    and "7 * a = 4 * b"
    and "d = c"   
  shows "63 * a = 80 * c"
proof -
  have "c = d" using assms(4) by simp
  have "b = (20/9) * c" using assms(2) by simp
  have "a = (4/7) * b" using assms(3) by simp
  show ?thesis by (simp add: `b = (20/9) * c` `a = (4/7) * b`)
qed

  assumes "y = k * x" and "z = m * y" 
  shows "z = m * (k * x)"
proof -

  then show ?thesis using assms(1) by simp
qed

lemma basic_arithmetic:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a = -1" "b = 5"
  shows "-a - b^2 + 3 * (a * b) = -39"
proof -
  have "b^2 = 25" using assms(2) by simp
  have "a * b = -5" using assms by simp
  then have "3 * (a * b) = -15" by simp
  have "-a = 1" using assms(1) by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    using `-a = 1` `b^2 = 25` `3 * (a * b) = -15` 
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
qed

lemma isolate_c:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + b + 3 * c = 19"
      and "a + b + c = 5"
  shows "c = 7"
proof -
  have "a + b + 3 * c - (a + b + c) = 19 - 5"
    using assms by (simp)
  have "2 * c = 14" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * c = 14\<close>)
qed

lemma isolate_b:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
      and "a + b + c = 5"
  shows "b = 2"
proof -
  have "a + 3 * b + c - (a + b + c) = 9 - 5"
    using assms by (simp)
  have "2 * b = 4" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * b = 4\<close>)
qed

lemma isolate_a:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
      and "a + b + c = 5"
  shows "a = -4"
proof -
  have "3 * a + b + c - (a + b + c) = -3 - 5"
    using assms by (simp)
  have "2 * a = -8" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * a = - 8\<close>)
qed

lemma linear_equations_sum:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
      and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
      and "a + b + 3 * c = 19"
  shows "a + b + c = 5"
proof -
  have "3 * a + b + c + a + 3 * b + c + a + b + 3 * c = -3 + 9 + 19"
    using assms by simp
  have "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2) assms(3))
  have "a + b + c = 5" by (smt (verit) \<open>5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25\<close>)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_338:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and "a + b + 3 * c = 19" 
  shows "a * b * c = -56"
proof -
  have "a + b + c = 5" using linear_equations_sum assms by simp
  have a_val: "a = -4" using isolate_a assms by simp
  have b_val: "b = 2" using isolate_b assms by simp
  have c_val: "c = 7" using isolate_c assms by simp
  have "a * b * c = (-4) * 2 * 7"
    using a_val b_val c_val by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_419:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a = -1"
    and "b = 5"
  shows "-a - b^2 + 3 * (a * b) = -39"
proof -
  have "b^2 = 25" using assms(2) by simp
  have "a * b = -5" using assms by simp
  then have "3 * (a * b) = -15" by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    using assms(1) by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_513:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5"
    and "a + b = 2" 
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 1"
proof -
  have eq1: "3 * a + 2 * b = 5" using assms(1) by simp
  have eq2: "a + b = 2" using assms(2) by simp
  have eq2_modified: "2 * (a + b) = 2 * 2" by (simp add: eq2)
  then have "2 * a + 2 * b = 4" by simp
  have "3 * a + 2 * b - (2 * a + 2 * b) = 5 - 4" 
    using eq1 `2 * a + 2 * b = 4` by simp
  then have "3 * a - 2 * a = 1" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a = 1" by (simp)
  have b_eq: "1 + b = 2" using `a = 1` eq2 by simp
  then have "b = 2 - 1" by (simp)
  then show ?thesis using `a = 1` by simp
qed

lemma extend_to_3D:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "x^2 + 8 * x + y^2 - 6 * y + z^2 = 0"
  shows "(x + 4)^2 + (y - 3)^2 + z^2 = 5^2"
proof -
  have x_square: "(x^2 + 8 * x) = (x + 4)^2 - 16" 
    by sos
  have y_square: "(y^2 - 6 * y) = (y - 3)^2 - 9" 
    by sos
  have equation: "(x + 4)^2 - 16 + (y - 3)^2 - 9 + z^2 = 0" 
    using x_square y_square assms by simp
  have simplified: "(x + 4)^2 + (y - 3)^2 + z^2 = 25" 
    using equation by simp
  show ?thesis 
    using simplified by simp
qed

     and "x^2 - 10 * x - (c + 40) = a - 40"

    using assms by simp

lemma polynomial_expansion:
  fixes x :: real
  shows "(x + c)^2 * x = x^3 + 2 * c * x^2 + c^2 * x"
proof -
  have expansion: "(x + c)^2 = (x + c) * (x + c)"
    by sos
  have expanded: "(x + c) * (x + c) = x * x + x * c + c * x + c * c"
    by sos
  then have "(x + c)^2 = x^2 + 2 * c * x + c^2"
    by sos
  have "(x + c)^2 * x = (x^2 + 2 * c * x + c^2) * x"
    using expansion by sos
  have " (x^2 + 2 * c * x + c^2) * x = x^2 * x + 2 * c * x * x + c^2 * x"
    by sos
  then have " (x^2 + 2 * c * x + c^2) * x = x^3 + 2 * c * x^2 + c^2 * x"
    by sos
  thus ?thesis by sos
qed

lemma polynomial_expansion:
  fixes x :: real
  shows "(x + a)^2 * x = x^3 + 2*a*x^2 + a^2*x"
proof -
  have expansion: "(x + a)^2 = (x + a) * (x + a)"
    by sos
  have expanded: "(x + a) * (x + a) = x * x + x * a + a * x + a * a"
    by sos
  then have "(x + a)^2 = x^2 + 2 * a * x + a^2"
    by sos
  have "(x + a)^2 * x = (x^2 + 2 * a * x + a^2) * x"
    using expansion by sos
  have " (x^2 + 2 * a * x + a^2) * x = x^2 * x + 2 * a * x * x + a^2 * x"
    by sos
  then have " (x^2 + 2 * a * x + a^2) * x = x^3 + 2 * a * x^2 + a^2 * x"
    by sos
  thus ?thesis by sos
qed

lemma solve_line_equations:
  fixes m b :: real
  assumes "m * 7 + b = -1" and "m * (-1) + b = 7"
  shows "m + b = 5"
proof -
  have "b = -1 - m * 7" using assms(1) by simp
  have "m * (-1) + (-1 - m * 7) = 7" using assms(2) by (metis \<open>b = - 1 - m * 7\<close>)
  have "m * (-1) - 1 - m * 7 = 7" by (smt (verit) \<open>b = - 1 - m * 7\<close> assms(2))
  have "-m - 1 - 7 = m * 7" by (smt (verit) \<open>m * - 1 - 1 - m * 7 = 7\<close>)
  then have "-m - 8 = m * 7" by simp
  have "0 = m * 8 + 8" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  have "m * 8 = -8" by (metis \<open>0 = m * 8 + 8\<close> diff_minus_eq_add eq_iff_diff_eq_0 verit_minus_simplify(3))
  then have "m = -1" by simp
  have "b = -1 - (-1 * 7)" using `m = -1` by (metis \<open>b = - 1 - m * 7\<close>)
  have "b = -1 + 7" by (metis \<open>m = - 1\<close> add.comm_neutral add.commute assms(2) diff_self group_cancel.add2 minus_real_def mult_minus1_right one_plus_BitM or_not_num_neg.simps(2))
  then have "b = 6" by simp
  have "m + b = -1 + 6" by (metis \<open>b = 6\<close> \<open>m = - 1\<close> add_right_imp_eq cancel_ab_semigroup_add_class.diff_right_commute diff_add_cancel diff_diff_eq2 diff_eq_diff_eq diff_minus_eq_add semiring_norm(5) uminus_add_conv_diff verit_minus_simplify(3))
  thus "m + b = 5" by simp
qed

lemma cancle_div:

  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -

    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)

theorem mathd_algebra_143_generalized:
  fixes f g h :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = x + 1"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x^2 + 3"
    and "\<forall> x. h x = f (g x)"
  shows "h 2 = 8"
proof -
  have g_eval: "g 2 = 2^2 + 3" using assms(2) by auto
  then have g_eval_result: "g 2 = 4 + 3" by simp
  then have g_result: "g 2 = 7" by simp
  have h_eval: "h 2 = f (g 2)" using assms(3) by simp
  have f_eval: "h 2 = f 7" using g_result by (metis dbl_simps(3) h_eval)
  have f_result: "f 7 = 7 + 1" using assms(1) by auto
  then have f_value: "f 7 = 8" by simp
  then show ?thesis using h_eval f_value by (metis assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) g_result semiring_norm(3))
qed

lemma fraction_manipulation_general:

  shows "(a / b) - (a / d) = a * (1 / b - 1 / d)"
proof -

  then show ?thesis by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

lemma simplify_rational_expression:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0"

proof -

    by (simp add: field_simps)

lemma log_exponentiation:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "b \<noteq> 1"
  shows "log b (a^c) = c * log b a"
proof -
  have "log b (a^c) = ln (a^c) / ln b" using assms by (simp add: log_base_conversion)
  also have "... = (c * ln a) / ln b" by (metis assms(1) ln_realpow)
  finally show ?thesis using assms by (simp add: log_base_conversion)
qed

lemma cal_log_value:
  assumes "a > 0" and "a ≠ 1" and "b > 0" and "log a b = c"
  shows "b = a ^ c"
by (metis assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) assms(4) powr_log_cancel powr_realpow)

lemma cal_log_exp_value:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "a ≠ 1" "n > 0"
  shows "log a (a^n) = n"
proof -
  have c0: "log a a = 1"
    by (simp add: assms(1) assms(2))
  have "log a (a^n) = n * (log a a)"
    using log_nat_power[of a a n] by (simp add: assms(1))
  then have c1: "log a (a^n) = n"
    using c0 by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by (simp add: c1)
qed

lemma log_properties:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "a \<noteq> 1" "b > 0" "b \<noteq> 1" "c > 0"
  shows "log a (b * c) = log a b + log a c" and "log a (b / c) = log a b - log a c"
proof -
  have log_def: "log a x = ln x / ln a" for x :: real using assms by (simp add: log_def)
  have "log a (b * c) = ln (b * c) / ln a" using assms log_def by blast
  also have "... = (ln b + ln c) / ln a" using assms by (metis ln_mult)
  also have "... = log a b + log a c" using assms log_def by (metis add_divide_distrib)
  finally show "log a (b * c) = log a b + log a c" .
  have "log a (b / c) = ln (b / c) / ln a" using assms log_def by blast
  also have "... = (ln b - ln c) / ln a" using assms by (metis ln_div)
  also have "... = log a b - log a c" using assms log_def by (metis diff_divide_distrib)
  finally show "log a (b / c) = log a b - log a c" .
qed

  shows "b = c - a"

  then show ?thesis by (metis add.commute add_cancel_left_right assms crossproduct_eq diff_add_eq_diff_diff_swap diff_eq_diff_eq eq_iff_diff_eq_0 minus_diff_eq mult.commute mult_cancel_right2 mult_eq_0_iff mult_minus_right neg_0_equal_iff_equal zero_neq_neg_one)

lemma linear_system_solution:
  fixes x y a b :: real
  assumes "a + b = 25" "a - b = 11"
  shows "a = 18"
proof -
  have "a + b + (a - b) = 25 + 11" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "2 * a = 36" by simp
  thus ?thesis using `2 * a = 36` by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

theorem linear_combination:
  fixes a b c x y :: real
  assumes "a + b = c" "a - b = x"
  shows "a = (c + x) / 2" and "b = (c - x) / 2"
proof -
  have "a + b + (a - b) = c + x" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "2 * a = c + x" by simp
  thus "a = (c + x) / 2" using field_simps by simp
  have "a - b = x" by (simp add: assms(2))
  then have "b = a - x" using `a = (c + x) / 2` by fastforce
  thus "b = (c - x) / 2" using `a = (c + x) / 2` by simp
qed

lemma gcd_properties:
  fixes a b :: nat
  shows "gcd a b = gcd b (a mod b)"
proof (induction b)
  case 0
  then show ?case by auto
next
  case (Suc n)
  then show ?case
  proof -
    have "a mod (Suc n) < Suc n" by simp
    moreover have "gcd (Suc n) (a mod (Suc n)) = gcd (a mod (Suc n)) (Suc n)"
      by (metis gcd.commute)
    ultimately show ?thesis
      by auto
  qed
qed

lemma gcd_lcm_relation:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "gcd a b = g"
  shows "lcm a b = (a * b) div g"
proof -
  have "lcm a b * gcd a b = a * b" 
    using assms by auto
  then have "lcm a b = (a * b) div gcd a b" 
    by (metis lcm_nat_def)
  thus ?thesis 
    using assms by simp
qed

lemma gcd_lcm_relation:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "gcd a b = g" 
  shows "lcm a b = (a * b) div g"
proof -
  have "gcd a b * lcm a b = a * b" 
    using assms by auto
  then have "g * lcm a b = a * b" 
    using assms by auto
  then show ?thesis 
    using `gcd a b = g` by (smt (verit) lcm_nat_def)
qed

lemma mod_large_number:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "b > 0"
  shows "a mod b = a - (a div b) * b"
  using assms by (metis modulo_nat_def)

lemma mod_mult:
  fixes a b n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "(a * b) mod n = ((a mod n) * (b mod n)) mod n"
  using mod_large_number[of a n] mod_large_number[of b n]
  by (metis mod_mult_eq)

lemma mod_large_number_multi:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "b > 0"
  shows "(c * a) mod b = (c * (a mod b)) mod b"
proof -
  have "c * a = c * ((a div b) * b + (a mod b))"
    by auto
  then show ?thesis 
    by (metis mod_mult_right_eq)
qed

lemma mod_large_number:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "b > 0"
  shows "a mod b = a - (a div b) * b"
  using assms by (metis modulo_nat_def)

lemma mod_add:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "b > 0" "c < b"
  shows "(a + c) mod b = ((a mod b) + c) mod b"
proof -
  have "a + c = (a mod b) + (a div b) * b + c" using assms by simp
  hence "(a + c) mod b = ((a mod b) + c) mod b" 
    using mod_large_number[of a b] by presburger
  thus ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"
proof -
  have "(x + b)^c mod n = ((x mod n) + b)^c mod n"
    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"
    using assms(4) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma generalize_fraction_multiplication:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0" "d \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(a / b) * (c / d) = (a * c) / (b * d)"
  using assms by (simp add: field_simps)

  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0" "d \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(a / b) * (c / d) = (a * c) / (b * d)"
  using generalize_fraction_multiplication[of a b c d] assms by simp

lemma mod_10_sum:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a mod 10 + b mod 10 < 10"
  shows "(a + b) mod 10 = (a mod 10 + b mod 10)"
proof -
  have "a + b = (a div 10) * 10 + (a mod 10) + (b div 10) * 10 + (b mod 10)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a + b = ((a div 10) + (b div 10)) * 10 + ((a mod 10) + (b mod 10))"
    by (simp only: algebra_simps)
  have "((a + b) mod 10) = (((a div 10) + (b div 10)) * 10 + (a mod 10 + b mod 10)) mod 10"
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = (a mod 10 + b mod 10) mod 10"
  proof -
    have "((a div 10) + (b div 10)) * 10 mod 10 = 0"
      by (simp add: mod_mult_self2)
    thus ?thesis
      by fastforce
  qed
  finally show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>((a div 10 + b div 10) * 10 + (a mod 10 + b mod 10)) mod 10 = (a mod 10 + b mod 10) mod 10\<close> \<open>(a + b) mod 10 = ((a div 10 + b div 10) * 10 + (a mod 10 + b mod 10)) mod 10\<close> assms mod_less)
qed

lemma sum_modulus:
  fixes a b :: nat
  shows "(a + b) mod 10 = ((a mod 10) + (b mod 10)) mod 10"
proof -
  have "a + b = (a div 10) * 10 + (a mod 10) + (b div 10) * 10 + (b mod 10)"
    by auto
  then have "a + b = ((a div 10) + (b div 10)) * 10 + ((a mod 10) + (b mod 10))"
    by (simp only: algebra_simps)
  then have "(a + b) mod 10 = (((a div 10) + (b div 10)) * 10 + ((a mod 10) + (b mod 10))) mod 10"
    by presburger
  also have "... = ((a mod 10) + (b mod 10)) mod 10"
    by (metis mod_mult_self3)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mod_addition:
  fixes a b :: nat
  shows "(a + b) mod n = ((a mod n) + (b mod n)) mod n"
proof -
  have "a + b = (a mod n) + (b mod n) + n * ((a div n) + (b div n))" 
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

  fixes a b p :: nat
  shows "(a + b) mod p = ((a mod p) + (b mod p)) mod p"
  by presburger

lemma multiplicative_inverse:
  fixes a b m :: int
  assumes "a * b mod m = 1"
  shows "\<exists>n. n * b mod m = 1"
proof -
  have "b * (a mod m) mod m = 1"
    using assms by (metis mod_mult_right_eq mult.commute)
  thus ?thesis by (auto simp: field_simps)
qed

lemma multiplicative_inverse_exists:
  fixes a b m :: int
  assumes "a * b mod m = 1"
  shows "\<exists>n. n * b mod m = 1"
proof -
  have "a * b mod m = 1" using assms by simp
  then have "b * a mod m = 1" by (metis mod_mult_right_eq mult.commute)
  then show ?thesis by (metis mod_mult_right_eq mult.commute)
qed

  assumes "\<forall>n. a (n + 6) mod 4 = a n mod 4"

theorem mathd_numbertheory_582:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "0 < n"
    and "3 dvd n"
  shows "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) mod 9 = 0"
proof -
  have sum_expr: "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8) = 3 * n + 18)" by simp
  obtain k where "n = 3 * k" using assms(2) by (metis dvd_def)
  have "3 * n + 18 = 9 * k + 18" using `n = 3 * k` by simp
  have "9 * k + 18 = 9 * k + 9 * 2" by simp
  then have "9 * (k + 2) = 9 * (k + 2)" by simp
  have "((3 * n + 18) mod 9) = (9 * (k + 2)) mod 9" by (smt (verit) \<open>3 * n + 18 = 9 * k + 18\<close> \<open>9 * k + 18 = 9 * k + 9 * 2\<close> add_mult_distrib2)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mod_power_periodicity:
  fixes a :: nat and m :: nat and k :: nat and n :: nat
  assumes "m > 0" and "a ^ k mod m = 1"
  shows "a^(k + n) mod m = a^n mod m"
proof -
  have "a^(k + n) mod m = (a^k * a^n) mod m" by (simp add: power_add)
  also have "... = (1 * a^n) mod m" using assms(2) by (smt (verit) mod_mult_left_eq)
  also have "... = a^n mod m" by (simp add: mod_mult_left_eq)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma arithmetic_sequence:
  fixes a :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall>n. a (n + 1) - a n = a (n + 2) - a (n + 1)"
  shows "a (n + 1) = a n + (a (n + 2) - a (n + 1))"
proof -
  have "a (n + 1) - a n = a (n + 2) - a (n + 1)" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: algebra_simps)
qed

lemma mod_addition:
  fixes a b m :: int
  shows "(a + b) mod m = ((a mod m) + (b mod m)) mod m"
proof -
  have "a + b = (a mod m) + (b mod m) + m * ((a div m) + (b div m))"
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "(a + b) mod m = (((a mod m) + (b mod m)) + m * ((a div m) + (b div m))) mod m"
    by auto
  also have "... = ((a mod m) + (b mod m)) mod m"
    by (metis mod_add_eq mod_mult_self2)

theorem mathd_algebra_171_more_complex:
  fixes n x :: real
  assumes "n + x = 97" and "n + 5 * x = 265"
  shows "n + 2 * x = 139"
proof -
  from assms have "n = 97 - x" by simp
  then have "n + 5 * x = (97 - x) + 5 * x" by simp
  also have "... = 97 + 4 * x" by simp
  from this and assms(2) have "97 + 4 * x = 265" by (metis \<open>n = 97 - x\<close> assms(1))
  thus ?thesis using assms(1) by (simp add: algebra_simps)
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"
proof -
  have "(x + b)^c mod n = ((x mod n) + b)^c mod n"
    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"
    using assms(4) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma mod_add:
  fixes a b m :: nat
  assumes "a mod m = x" and "b mod m = y"
  shows "(a + b) mod m = (x + y) mod m"
proof -
  have "a = m * (a div m) + x" using assms(1) by auto
  have "b = m * (b div m) + y" using assms(2) by auto
  then have "a + b = m * (a div m) + x + m * (b div m) + y" by (smt (verit) \<open>a = m * (a div m) + x\<close> ab_semigroup_add_class.add_ac(1))
  then have "a + b = m * ((a div m) + (b div m)) + (x + y)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "(a + b) mod m = (x + y) mod m" by (simp add: mod_add_eq)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

```isabelle
  fixes x p :: real
  assumes "0 < p" "p < 15" "p \<le> x" "x \<le> 15"
  shows "abs (x - p) + abs (x - 15) + abs (x - p - 15) = 30 - x"
proof -
  
  have "abs (x - p) = x - p" using assms(3) by auto
  have "abs (x - 15) = 15 - x" using assms(4) by auto
  have "abs (x - p - 15) = 15 + p - x" 
    using assms(2) assms(4) by auto

  
  have "abs (x - p) + abs (x - 15) + abs (x - p - 15) = (x - p) + (15 - x) + (15 + p - x)" 
    using `abs (x - p) = x - p` and `abs (x - 15) = 15 - x` and `abs (x - p - 15) = 15 + p - x` by auto

  
  then have "... = x - p + 15 - x + 15 + p - x" by simp
  also have "... = 30 - x" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed


theorem aime_1983_p2:
  fixes x p ::real and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0: "0 < p \<and> p < 15"
      and h1: "p \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 15"
      and h2: "f x = abs (x - p) + abs (x - 15) + abs (x - p - 15)" 
    shows "15 \<le> f x"
proof -
  
  have "f x = abs (x - p) + abs (x - 15) + abs (x - p - 15)"
    using h2 by simp
  
  
  have "f x = 30 - x" using calculate_f[of x p] h0 h1 by auto
  
  
  have "30 - x \<ge> 30 - 15" using h1 by auto

  
  thus "15 \<le> f x" by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
begin


theorem algebra_sqineq_at2malt1:
  fixes a::real 
  shows "a * (2 - a) \<le> 1"
proof -
  
  have c0: "a * (2 - a) = 2 * a - a^2" by simp
  
  
  have c1: "2 * a - a^2 - 1 \<le> 0"

  have c2: "-(a^2 - 2 * a + 1) \<le> 0" 
    using c1 by simp

  have c4: "(a - 1)^2 \<ge> 0" by (simp add: real_squared_nonneg)
  
  
  show ?thesis using c2 c3 c4 by auto
qed
```

```isabelle
theory algebra_sqineq_unitcircatbpabsamblt1
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma square_non_negative:
  fixes x :: real
  shows "x^2 \<ge> 0"
  by (simp add: mult_nonneg_nonneg)


theorem algebra_sqineq_unitcircatbpabsamblt1:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes h0: "a^2 + b^2 = 1" 
  shows "a * b + \<bar>a - b\<bar> \<le> 1"
proof -
  
  
  
  have abs_diff: "\<bar>a - b\<bar> = sqrt ((a - b)^2)" by (rule abs_diff_square)

  
  have "(a - b)^2 = a^2 - 2*a*b + b^2" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)

  
  have diff_square: "(a - b)^2 = 1 - 2*a*b" using h0 by simp

  
  then have abs_eq: "\<bar>a - b\<bar> = sqrt(1 - 2*a*b)" using abs_diff diff_square by auto

  
  have "a*b + \<bar>a - b\<bar> = a*b + sqrt(1 - 2*a*b)" by (simp add: abs_eq)

  
  have "a*b + sqrt(1 - 2*a*b) \<le> 1" if "sqrt(1 - 2*a*b) \<le> 1 - a*b" for a b
    using that by simp

  
  
  have "1 - 2*a*b \<le> (1 - a*b)^2" 
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square)

  
  
  have "0 \<le> (a*b)^2" by (simp add: square_non_negative)

  
  show "a*b + \<bar>a - b\<bar> \<le> 1" using h0
    by (metis add_nonneg_nonneg less_eq_real_def mult_nonneg_nonneg)
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theorem algebra_sqineq_unitcircatbpamblt1:
  fixes a b:: real
  assumes h0: "a^2 + b^2 = 1"
  shows "a * b + (a - b) \<le> 1"
proof -
  
  
  
  
  
  have "a * b + (a - b) = a + (a * b) - b" by simp
  
  
  have "0 \<le> (a - b - 1)^2" by (simp)

  
  have "(a - b)^2 = a^2 - 2 * a * b + b^2" by simp

  
  have "0 \<le> (1 - 2 * a * b) - 2 * (a - b) + 1" using h0 by simp

  
  have "0 \<le> 2 - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b" by simp

  
  have "2 * a * b + 2 * a - 2 * b \<le> 2" by simp

  
  have "a * b + a - b \<le> 1" by simp

  
  show ?thesis using `a * b + a - b \<le> 1` by simp
qed
```

```isabelle
theory amc12a_2009_p6
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem amc12a_2009_p6:
  fixes m n p q :: real
  assumes  "p = 2 powr m"
    and "q = 3 powr n"
  shows "p powr (2 * n) * (q powr m) = 12 powr (m * n)"
proof -
  
  have "12 powr (m * n) = (2^2 * 3^1) powr (m * n)" by simp
  
  
  also have "... = (2^2) powr (m * n) * (3^1) powr (m * n)" by (simp add: power_add)

  
  also have "... = (2 powr m) powr (2 * n) * (3 powr n) powr m" unfolding assms by (simp add: power_mult)

  
  also have "... = p powr (2 * n) * (q powr m)" unfolding assms by (simp add: power_mult)

  
  finally have "p powr (2 * n) * (q powr m) = 12 powr (m * n)" by simp
  
  
  show ?thesis by (simp add: this)
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory amc12a_2021_p3
  imports Complex_Main
begin




theorem amc12a_2021_p3:
  fixes x y :: nat
 assumes h0: "x + y = 17402"
   and h1: "10 dvd x"
   and h2: "x div 10 = y" 
 shows "x - y = 14238"
proof -
  
  from h1 obtain k where "x = 10 * k" by (auto simp: dvd_def)

  
  then have "10 * k + k = 17402" by (metis `x = 10 * k`)
  hence "11 * k = 17402" by simp

  
  have "k = 17402 div 11" by (simp add: div_mult_self2)
  then have "k = 1582" by (simp add: div_exact)

  
  have "y = k" by (metis `k = 17402 div 11`)
  have "x = 10 * y" by (metis `x = 10 * k`)

  
  have "x - y = (10 * y) - y" using `x = 10 * y` by simp
  then have "x - y = 9 * y" by (simp add: difference_of_numbers)

  
  have "x - y = 9 * 1582" by (metis `y = k`)
  thus "x - y = 14238" by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory amc12a_2021_p9 
  imports Complex_Main 
begin


lemma prod_sum_of_powers:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(\<Prod> k < n. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k))) = (3::nat)^(2^n) - 2^(2^n)"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case 
    by auto
next
  case (Suc n)
  then have IH: "(\<Prod> k < n. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k))) = (3::nat)^(2^n) - 2^(2^n)" 
    by simp
  have "(\<Prod> k < Suc n. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k))) = (\<Prod> k < n. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k))) * (2^(2^n) + 3^(2^n))"
    by (simp add: prod.atLeastLessThan_Suc)
  also have "... = ((3::nat)^(2^n) - 2^(2^n)) * (2^(2^n) + 3^(2^n))" 
    using IH by simp
  also have "... = 3^(2^n) * 3^(2^n) - 2^(2^n) * 2^(2^n)" 
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 3^(2^(Suc n)) - 2^(2^(Suc n))" 
    by (metis power2_eq_square power_Suc power_even_eq semiring_norm(3))
  finally show ?case by simp
qed


theorem amc12a_2021_p9 :
  shows "(\<Prod> k<7. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k))) = (3::nat)^128 - 2^128"
proof -
  
  have "(\<Prod> k<7. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k))) = (\<Prod> k<7. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k)))" by simp

  
  then have "(\<Prod> k<7. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k))) = (3::nat)^(2^7) - 2^(2^7)"
    using prod_sum_of_powers[of 7] by simp

  
  then have "(\<Prod> k<7. (2^(2^k) + 3^(2^k))) = (3::nat)^(128) - 2^(128)" by simp

  
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory amc12b_2020_p6
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem amc12b_2020_p6:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0: "9 \<le> n" 
  shows "\<exists>x::nat. (real_of_nat x)^2 = (fact (n + 2) 
              - fact (n + 1)) / fact n"
proof -
  
  have expression: "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n = (fact (n + 1) * (n + 1)) / fact n"
    
    by (simp add: fact_Suc)

  
  have part1: "(fact (n + 1) * (n + 1)) / fact n = (n + 1) * (fact (n + 1) / fact n)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have part2: "fact (n + 1) / fact n = n + 1"
    by (simp add: fact_Suc)

  
  have result: "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n = (n + 1) * (n + 1)"
    using expression part1 part2 by auto

  
  have is_perfect_square: "\<exists>x::nat. (real_of_nat x)^2 = (n + 1)^2"
    
    by (metis (full_types) nat.exhaust)

  
  thus ?thesis using result is_perfect_square by auto
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory amc12b_2021_p3
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma isolate_fraction:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0: "2 + 1 / (1 + 1 / (2 + 2 / (3 + x))) = 144 / 53"
  shows "1 / (1 + 1 / (2 + 2 / (3 + x))) = 38 / 53"
proof -
  
  have step1: "2 + 1 / (1 + 1 / (2 + 2 / (3 + x))) = 144 / 53" using h0 by simp
  
  have "1 / (1 + 1 / (2 + 2 / (3 + x))) = (144 / 53) - 2" 
    using step1 by (simp add: field_simps)
  
  also have "... = (144 / 53) - (106 / 53)" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = (144 - 106) / 53" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = 38 / 53" by simp
  
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed


theorem amc12b_2021_p3:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0: "2 + 1 / (1 + 1 / (2 + 2 / (3 + x))) = 144 / 53" 
  shows "x = 3 / 4"
proof -
  
  have step1: "1 / (1 + 1 / (2 + 2 / (3 + x))) = 38 / 53" 
    using isolate_fraction[of x] h0 by simp
  
  have step2: "1 + 1 / (2 + 2 / (3 + x)) = (53 / 38)" 
    using step1 by (simp add: field_simps)
  
  have step3: "1 / (2 + 2 / (3 + x)) = (53 / 38) - 1" 
    using step2 by (simp add: field_simps)
  
  also have "... = (53 / 38) - (38 / 38)" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = (53 - 38) / 38" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = 15 / 38" by simp
  finally have step4: "1 / (2 + 2 / (3 + x)) = 15 / 38" by simp

  
  have step5: "2 + 2 / (3 + x) = (38 / 15)" 
    using step4 by (simp add: field_simps)
  
  have step6: "2 / (3 + x) = (38 / 15) - 2" 
    using step5 by (simp add: field_simps)
  
  also have "... = (38 / 15) - (30 / 15)" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = (38 - 30) / 15" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = 8 / 15" by simp
  finally have step7: "2 / (3 + x) = 8 / 15" by simp

  
  have step8: "3 + x = (2 * 15) / 8" 
    using step7 by (simp add: field_simps)
  
  also have "... = (30 / 8)" by simp
  also have "... = (15 / 4)" by simp
  finally have step9: "3 + x = 15 / 4" by simp

  
  have "x = (15 / 4) - 3" 
    using step9 by simp
  also have "... = (15 / 4) - (12 / 4)" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = (15 - 12) / 4" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = 3 / 4" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory induction_1pxpownlt1pnx
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem induction_1pxpownlt1pnx:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(1 + n*x) \<le> (1 + x)^n"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  
  
  have "1 + 0 * x = 1" by simp
  have "(1 + x)^0 = 1" by simp
  thus ?case by simp

next
  case (Suc n)
  
  
  have "1 + n * x ≤ (1 + x)^n" using Suc.IH by simp

  
  
  have "1 + (n + 1) * x = 1 + n * x + x" by (simp add: field_simps)

  
  also have "... ≤ (1 + x)^n + x" using `1 + n * x ≤ (1 + x)^n` by simp

  
  
  have "(1 + x)^(n + 1) = (1 + x) * (1 + x)^n" by (simp add: power_Suc)

  
  
  
  
  have "x * (1 + x)^n ≥ x" if "x > 0" using that by (simp add: mult_nonneg_nonneg)
  
  
  
  
  
  thus ?case by (simp add: power_Suc)
qed

end
```

```isabelle
  have eq5: "- (inverse a) = (1 / 2)" by simp

  
  have eq6: "(inverse a) = - (1 / 2)" using eq5 by simp

  
  have "a = -2" using eq6 by (simp add: field_simps)
```

```isabelle
  then show ?thesis using enrollment_relation by simp
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_141
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma sum_of_squares:
  fixes x y :: real
  shows "x^2 + y^2 = (x + y)^2 - 2 * x * y"
  by (simp add: power2_eq_square)


theorem mathd_algebra_141:
  fixes a b ::real
  assumes "(a * b)=180"
    and "2 * (a + b)=54"
  shows "a^2 + b^2 = 369"
proof -
  
  have "a + b = 27" using assms(2) by simp

  
  have "a^2 + b^2 = (a + b)^2 - 2 * a * b" using sum_of_squares by simp

  
  also have "... = 27^2 - 2 * 180" using assms(1) by (metis \<open>a + b = 27\<close> mult.assoc mult.commute mult.left_commute)

  
  also have "... = 729 - 360" by simp

  
  also have "... = 369" by simp

  
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_142
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma solve_line_equations:
  fixes m b :: real
  assumes "m * 7 + b = -1" and "m * (-1) + b = 7"
  shows "m + b = 5"
proof -
  
  have "b = -1 - m * 7" using assms(1) by simp

  
  have "m * (-1) + (-1 - m * 7) = 7" using assms(2) by simp
  
  have "m * (-1) - 1 - m * 7 = 7" by simp

  
  have "-m - 1 - 7 = m * 7" by simp
  then have "-m - 8 = m * 7" by simp
  
  have "0 = m * 8 + 8" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  
  
  have "m * 8 = -8" by simp
  then have "m = -1" by simp

  
  have "b = -1 - (-1 * 7)" using `m = -1` by simp
  have "b = -1 + 7" by simp
  then have "b = 6" by simp
  
  
  have "m + b = -1 + 6" by simp
  thus "m + b = 5" by simp
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_142:
  fixes m b ::real
  assumes "m * 7 + b = -1"
    and "m * (-1) + b = 7" 
  shows "m + b = 5"
  using solve_line_equations[of m b] assms by auto

end
```

```isabelle
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = x + 1"

  shows "f (g 2) = 8"
proof -

  then have g_eval_result: "g 2 = 4 + 3" by simp
  then have g_result: "g 2 = 7" by simp
  
  
  have f_eval: "f (g 2) = f 7" using g_result by simp
  
  
  have f_result: "f 7 = 7 + 1" using assms(1) by auto
  then have f_value: "f 7 = 8" by simp
  
  
  then show ?thesis using f_eval f_value by simp
qed
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_148
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_algebra_148:
  fixes c :: real and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = c * x^3 - 9 * x + 3"
    and  "f 2 = 9" 
  shows "c = 3"
proof -
  
  have f_eval: "f 2 = c * (2^3) - 9 * 2 + 3" using assms(1) by simp
  
  
  have "f 2 = c * 8 - 18 + 3" by (simp add: f_eval)
  
  have f_2_expr: "f 2 = 8 * c - 15" by simp

  
  have "8 * c - 15 = 9" using assms(2) f_2_expr by simp

  
  have "8 * c = 9 + 15" by (simp add: field_simps)
  have "8 * c = 24" by simp
  then have "c = 24 / 8" by (simp add: nonzero_mult_div_cancel_left[of 8 24])
  
  
  thus "c = 3" by simp
qed
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_153
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma floor_of_fraction:
  fixes n :: real
  assumes "n = 1 / 3"
  shows "floor (10 * n) = 3" 
  using assms by fastforce

lemma floor_of_fraction_100:
  fixes n :: real
  assumes "n = 1 / 3"
  shows "floor (100 * n) = 33" 
  using assms by fastforce

lemma floor_of_fraction_1000:
  fixes n :: real
  assumes "n = 1 / 3"
  shows "floor (1000 * n) = 333" 
  using assms by fastforce

lemma floor_of_fraction_10000:
  fixes n :: real
  assumes "n = 1 / 3"
  shows "floor (10000 * n) = 3333" 
  using assms by fastforce


theorem mathd_algebra_153:
  fixes n :: real
  assumes "n = 1 / 3" 
  shows "floor (10 * n) + floor (100 * n) + floor (1000 * n) + floor (10000 * n) = 3702"
proof -
  
  have term1: "floor (10 * n) = 3" using floor_of_fraction assms by simp
  have term2: "floor (100 * n) = 33" using floor_of_fraction_100 assms by simp
  have term3: "floor (1000 * n) = 333" using floor_of_fraction_1000 assms by simp
  have term4: "floor (10000 * n) = 3333" using floor_of_fraction_10000 assms by simp

  
  have sum: "floor (10 * n) + floor (100 * n) + floor (1000 * n) + floor (10000 * n) = 
                3 + 33 + 333 + 3333"
    using term1 term2 term3 term4 by simp

  
  also have "... = 3702" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_156
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma quadratic_factor:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "b^2 - 4 * a * c = 0" 
  shows "((b / (2 * a)) - sqrt (b^2 - 4 * a * c) / (2 * a)) * ((b / (2 * a)) + sqrt (b^2 - 4 * a * c) / (2 * a)) = c / a"
  using assms by (smt (verit) divide_zero_iff_eq zero_less_mult_iff)


theorem mathd_algebra_156:
  fixes x y :: real
    and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall>t. f t = t^4"
  and "\<forall>t. g t = 5 * t^2 - 6"
  and "f x = g x"
  and "f y = g y"
  and "x^2 < y^2" 
  shows "y^2 - x^2 = 1"
proof -
  
  have eq: "x^4 = 5 * x^2 - 6" using assms(3) by auto
  have eq2: "y^4 = 5 * y^2 - 6" using assms(4) by auto

  
  have "x^4 - 5 * x^2 + 6 = 0" using eq by simp
  have "y^4 - 5 * y^2 + 6 = 0" using eq2 by simp

  
  define z where "z = x^2"
  have "z^2 - 5 * z + 6 = 0" using z_def by simp
  define z' where "z' = y^2"
  have "z'^2 - 5 * z' + 6 = 0" using z'_def by simp

  
  have "z^2 - 5 * z + 6 = (z - 2) * (z - 3)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "z'^2 - 5 * z' + 6 = (z' - 2) * (z' - 3)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have "z = 2 \<or> z = 3" using z_def by auto
  have "z' = 2 \<or> z' = 3" using z'_def by auto

  
  obtain a where "x^2 = a" "y^2 = a + 1" using assms(5) by auto
  thus ?thesis using `x^2 < y^2` by auto
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_160
imports Complex_Main 
begin


lemma solve_linear_system:
  fixes n x :: real
  assumes "n + x = 97" and "n + 5 * x = 265"
  shows "n + 2 * x = 139"
proof -
  
  have "n + 5 * x - (n + x) = 265 - 97" using assms by simp

  
  then have "4 * x = 168" by simp

  
  have "x = 42" using `4 * x = 168` by (simp add: field_simps)

  
  have "n + 42 = 97" using assms(1) `x = 42` by simp

  
  then have "n = 55" by (simp add: field_simps)

  
  have "n + 2 * x = 55 + 2 * 42" by (simp add: `n = 55` `x = 42`)

  
  then show "n + 2 * x = 139" by simp
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_160:
  fixes n x :: real
  assumes "n + x = 97"
      and "n + 5 * x = 265"
    shows "n + 2 * x = 139"
proof -
  
  show ?thesis using solve_linear_system[of n x] assms by simp
qed

end
```
