```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_17
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma isolate_sqrt:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "sqrt x = y" and "y >= 0"
  shows "x = y^2"
proof -
  have "y^2 >= 0" using assms(2) by auto
  have "x = (sqrt x)^2" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2) real_sqrt_ge_0_iff real_sqrt_pow2)
  thus ?thesis using assms(1) by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_17:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "sqrt (4 + sqrt (16 + 16 * a)) 
    + sqrt (1 + sqrt (1 + a)) = 6" 
  shows "a = 8"
proof -
  
  have eq: "sqrt (4 + sqrt (16 + 16 * a)) + sqrt (1 + sqrt (1 + a)) = 6" 
    using assms by simp

  
  have "sqrt (4 + sqrt (16 + 16 * a)) = 2 * sqrt (1 + sqrt (1 + a))"
    
    by (metis (no_types, lifting) add.commute sqrt_add_4 sqrt_mult_4)

  
  have "2 * sqrt (1 + sqrt (1 + a)) + sqrt (1 + sqrt (1 + a)) = 6"
    using eq by simp

  
  have "3 * sqrt (1 + sqrt (1 + a)) = 6" by simp

  
  have "sqrt (1 + sqrt (1 + a)) = 2" 
    using `3 * sqrt (1 + sqrt (1 + a)) = 6` by simp

  
  have "1 + sqrt (1 + a) = 4"
    by (metis (no_types, lifting) power2_eq_square)

  
  have "sqrt (1 + a) = 3" 
    using `1 + sqrt (1 + a) = 4` by simp

  
  have "1 + a = 9" 
    using isolate_sqrt[of "1 + a" "sqrt (1 + a)"] by (metis)

  
  show ?thesis using `1 + a = 9` by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_176
imports Complex_Main 
begin


theorem mathd_algebra_176:
  fixes x ::real
  shows "(x + 1)^2 * x = x^3 + 2 * x^2 + x"
proof -
  
  have expansion: "(x + 1)^2 = (x + 1) * (x + 1)"
    by simp

  
  have expanded: "(x + 1) * (x + 1) = x * x + x * 1 + 1 * x + 1 * 1"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then have "(x + 1)^2 = x^2 + 2 * x + 1"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have "(x + 1)^2 * x = (x^2 + 2 * x + 1) * x"
    using expansion by simp

  
  have " (x^2 + 2 * x + 1) * x = x^2 * x + 2 * x * x + 1 * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then have " (x^2 + 2 * x + 1) * x = x^3 + 2 * x^2 + x"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_184
  imports Complex_Main
begin





theorem mathd_algebra_184:
  fixes a b ::real
  assumes "0 < a \<and> 0 < b"
    and "(a^2) = 6*b"
    and "(a^2) = 54/b" 
  shows "a = 3 * sqrt 2"
proof -
  
  have "6 * b = 54 / b" using assms(2) assms(3) by simp

  
  have "6 * b^2 = 54" using `6 * b = 54 / b` by (simp add: mult.commute)

  
  have "b^2 = 54 / 6" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "b^2 = 9" by simp
  then have "b = sqrt 9" by (smt (verit) assms(1) less_eq_real_def real_sqrt_unique)
  
  
  then have "b = 3" by (simp add: assms(1))

  
  have "a^2 = 6 * b" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "a^2 = 6 * 3" using `b = 3` by simp
  then have "a^2 = 18" by simp

  
  have "a = sqrt 18" by (simp add: real_sqrt_unique)
  then have "a = 3 * sqrt 2" by (simp add: real_sqrt_mult)

  
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_246
  imports Complex_Main
begin




theorem mathd_algebra_246:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
    and "f (-3) = 2" 
  shows "f 3 = 8"
proof -
  
  
  
  have f_neg3: "f (-3) = a * (-3)^4 - b * (-3)^2 + (-3) + 5" 
    using assms(1) by simp
  
  have "f (-3) = a * 81 - b * 9 - 3 + 5" 
    by (simp add: f_neg3)
  
  have "f (-3) = 81 * a - 9 * b + 2" 
    by simp
  
  
  have eq1: "81 * a - 9 * b + 2 = 2" 
    using assms(2) by simp
  
  have "81 * a - 9 * b = 0" 
    by (simp add: eq1)

  
  have f_3: "f 3 = a * 3^4 - b * 3^2 + 3 + 5" 
    using assms(1) by simp
  
  have "f 3 = a * 81 - b * 9 + 3 + 5" 
    by (simp add: f_3)
  
  have "f 3 = 81 * a - 9 * b + 8" 
    by simp

  
  
  have "f 3 = 0 + 8" 
    using `81 * a - 9 * b = 0` by simp
  
  
  thus ?thesis 
    by simp
qed
```

```isabelle
  then have "x = 3 * 1" using `y = 1` by simp

  
  have "x = 3" by simp

  
  have "x + y = 3 + 1" using `x = 3` `y = 1` by simp

  
  thus ?thesis by simp
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_33
  imports Complex_Main
begin




lemma y_in_terms_of_x:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0" "2 * x = 5 * y"
  shows "y = (2/5) * x"
proof -
  have "5 * y = 2 * x" using assms(2) by simp
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: divide_simps)
qed


lemma z_in_terms_of_x:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0" "2 * x = 5 * y" "7 * y = 10 * z"
  shows "z = (7/25) * x"
proof -
  
  obtain y where y_def: "y = (2/5) * x" using y_in_terms_of_x[of x] assms by blast
  
  
  have "7 * y = 7 * ((2/5) * x)" using y_def by simp
  then have "10 * z = 7 * ((2/5) * x)" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "z = (7/10) * ((2/5) * x)" by (simp add: divide_simps)
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: field_simps)
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_33:
  fixes x y z :: real   
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0"
    and  "2 * x = 5 * y"
    and "7 * y = 10 * z"
  shows "z / x = 7 / 25"
proof -
  
  have "z = (7/25) * x" using z_in_terms_of_x[of x y z] assms by simp

  
  have "z / x = ((7/25) * x) / x" using `z = (7/25) * x` by simp

  
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_338
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma linear_equations_sum:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
      and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
      and "a + b + 3 * c = 19"
  shows "a + b + c = 5"
proof -
  
  have "3 * a + b + c + a + 3 * b + c + a + b + 3 * c = -3 + 9 + 19"
    using assms by simp
  
  have "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25" by simp
  
  have "a + b + c = 5" by (simp add: add_divide_distrib)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed


lemma isolate_a:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
      and "a + b + c = 5"
  shows "a = -4"
proof -
  
  have "3 * a + b + c - (a + b + c) = -3 - 5"
    using assms by (simp)
  
  have "2 * a = -8" by simp
  
  show ?thesis by (simp add: divide_simps)
qed

lemma isolate_b:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
      and "a + b + c = 5"
  shows "b = 2"
proof -
  
  have "a + 3 * b + c - (a + b + c) = 9 - 5"
    using assms by (simp)
  
  have "2 * b = 4" by simp
  
  show ?thesis by (simp add: divide_simps)
qed

lemma isolate_c:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + b + 3 * c = 19"
      and "a + b + c = 5"
  shows "c = 7"
proof -
  
  have "a + b + 3 * c - (a + b + c) = 19 - 5"
    using assms by (simp)
  
  have "2 * c = 14" by simp
  
  show ?thesis by (simp add: divide_simps)
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_338:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and "a + b + 3 * c = 19" 
  shows "a * b * c = -56"
proof -
  
  have "a + b + c = 5" using linear_equations_sum assms by simp
  
  have a_val: "a = -4" using isolate_a assms by simp
  have b_val: "b = 2" using isolate_b assms by simp
  have c_val: "c = 7" using isolate_c assms by simp
  
  
  have "a * b * c = (-4) * 2 * 7"
    using a_val b_val c_val by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_354
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma solve_linear_equations:
  fixes a d :: real
  assumes "a + 6 * d = 30" and "a + 10 * d = 60"
  shows "d = 15 / 2"
proof -
  have "a + 10 * d - (a + 6 * d) = 60 - 30" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "4 * d = 30" by simp
  then show "d = 15 / 2" by (simp add: field_simps)
qed


lemma find_a:
  fixes a d :: real
  assumes "a + 6 * d = 30" and "d = 15/2"
  shows "a = -15"
proof -
  have "a + 6 * (15 / 2) = 30" using assms by simp
  then have "a + 45 = 30" by simp
  then show "a = -15" by simp
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_354:
  fixes a d :: real
  assumes "a + 6 * d = 30"
    and "a + 10 * d = 60" 
  shows "a + 20 * d = 135"
proof -
  
  have d_val: "d = 15 / 2" using solve_linear_equations assms by simp

  
  have a_val: "a = -15" using find_a[where d="15/2"] d_val assms by simp

  
  have "a + 20 * d = -15 + 20 * (15 / 2)" by (simp add: d_val a_val)
  also have "... = -15 + 150" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theorem mathd_algebra_359:

  assumes "y + 6 + y = 2 * 12" 
  shows "y = 9"

    using `2 * y + 6 = 24` by simp

  
  have "2 * y = 18" 
    using `2 * y = 24 - 6` by simp

    using `2 * y = 18` by (metis nonzero_mult_div_cancel_right)

  
  have "y = 9" 
    using `y = 18 / 2` by simp

  
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_388
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma substitute_variable:
  fixes x y z w :: real
  assumes "y = w + 3 * z"
  shows "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10 \<Longrightarrow> 3 * x + 4 * w = 10"
     and "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4 \<Longrightarrow> -2 * x - 3 * w = -4"
proof -
  show "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10 \<Longrightarrow> 3 * x + 4 * w = 10"
  proof -
    assume h1: "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10"
    have "4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 4 * w + 12 * z - 12 * z" by simp
    thus "3 * x + 4 * w = 10" using h1 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  qed
  show "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4 \<Longrightarrow> -2 * x - 3 * w = -4"
  proof -
    assume h2: "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4"
    have "-3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -3 * w - 9 * z + 9 * z" by simp
    thus "-2 * x - 3 * w = -4" using h2 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  qed
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_388:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "3 * x + 4 * y - 12 * z = 10"
      and "-2 * x - 3 * y + 9 * z = -4"
    shows "x = 14"
proof -
  
  define w where "w = y - 3 * z"
  
  
  have eq1: "3 * x + 4 * (w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10"
    using assms(1) w_def by auto
  have eq2: "-2 * x - 3 * (w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4"
    using assms(2) w_def by auto
  
  
  have "3 * x + 4 * w = 10" using substitute_variable(1) eq1 by auto
  have "-2 * x - 3 * w = -4" using substitute_variable(2) eq2 by auto
  
  
  
  
  
  
  have "3 * w = -2 * x + 4" by (simp add: "-2 * x - 3 * w = -4")
  then have "w = (-2 * x + 4) / 3" by (simp add: divide_simps)
  
  
  have "3 * x + 4 * ((-2 * x + 4) / 3) = 10"
    by (simp add: "3 * x + 4 * w = 10")
  then have "3 * x + (4 * (-2 * x + 4)) / 3 = 10"
    by simp
  
  then have "9 * x + 4 * (-2 * x + 4) = 30" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "9 * x - 8 * x + 16 = 30" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "x + 16 = 30" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  
  
  then show "x = 14" by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_398
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma conversion_lags_to_lugs:
  fixes b c :: real
  assumes "9 * b = 20 * c"
  shows "b = (20 / 9) * c"
proof -
  have "b = (20 * c) / 9" using assms by (simp add: field_simps)
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: field_simps)
qed


lemma conversion_ligs_to_lags:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "7 * a = 4 * b"
  shows "a = (4 / 7) * b"
proof -
  have "a = (4 * b) / 7" using assms by (simp add: field_simps)
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: field_simps)
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_398:
  fixes a b c ::real
  assumes "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c"
    and "9 * b = 20 * c"
    and "7 * a = 4 * b"
  shows "63 * a = 80 * c"
proof -
  
  have "b = (20 / 9) * c" using conversion_lags_to_lugs `9 * b = 20 * c` by simp

  
  have "a = (4 / 7) * b" using conversion_ligs_to_lags `7 * a = 4 * b` by simp

  
  have "63 * a = 63 * ((4 / 7) * b)" using `a = (4 / 7) * b` by simp
  also have "... = (63 * 4 / 7) * b" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = (36) * b" by simp

  
  also have "... = 36 * ((20 / 9) * c)" using `b = (20 / 9) * c` by simp
  also have "... = (720 / 9) * c" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = 80 * c" by (simp add: field_simps)

  
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
  assumes "3 * x + y = 17"
    and "5 * y + z = 14"

    using assms by simp

    using eq1 by simp
  
  
  have rhs: "72 = 72" by simp

    using lhs rhs by simp

  
  have "x + y + z = 72 / 6"
    using `6 * (x + y + z) = 72` by (simp add: divide_simps)

  
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed
```

```isabelle
theorem mathd_algebra_432:
  fixes x ::real 
  shows "(x + 3) * (2 * x - 6) = 2 * x^2 - 18"
proof -
  
  have initial_expr: "(x + 3) * (2 * x - 6) = x * (2 * x - 6) + 3 * (2 * x - 6)"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)

  
  have part1: "x * (2 * x - 6) = 2 * x^2 - 6 * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)

  
  have part2: "3 * (2 * x - 6) = 6 * x - 18"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)

  
  have combined: "2 * x^2 - 6 * x + 6 * x - 18 = 2 * x^2 - 18"
    by (simp add: part1 part2)

  
  show ?thesis
    using initial_expr combined by (simp)
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_44
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_algebra_44:
  fixes s t :: real
  assumes "s = 9 - 2 * t"
    and "t = 3 * s + 1" 
  shows "s = 1 \<and> t = 4"
proof -
  
  
  
  have eq1: "s = 9 - 2 * (3 * s + 1)" using assms(1) assms(2) by simp

  
  have eq2: "s = 9 - 6 * s - 2" by (simp add: eq1)

  
  have eq3: "s + 6 * s = 7" by (simp add: eq2)

  
  have s_value: "7 * s = 7" using eq3 by simp
  then have s_result: "s = 1" by (simp add: field_simps)

  
  have t_value: "t = 3 * s + 1" using assms(2) s_result by simp
  
  
  then have t_result: "t = 3 * 1 + 1" by (metis s_result)
  then show ?thesis using s_result by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_484
  imports Complex_Main
begin



lemma log_base_conversion:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "b ≠ 1"
  shows "log b a = ln a / ln b"
  using assms by (simp add: log_def)


lemma log_exponentiation:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "b ≠ 1"
  shows "log b (a^c) = c * log b a"
  using assms by (simp add: log_base_conversion)


theorem mathd_algebra_484 :
  "(ln 27) / (ln 3) = (3::real)"
proof -
  
  have "log 3 27 = log 3 (3^3)"
    by (simp add: power3_eq_27)
  
  then have "log 3 (3^3) = 3 * log 3 3"
    using log_exponentiation[of 3 3 3] by simp
  
  also have "... = 3 * 1"
    by (simp add: log_def)
  finally show ?thesis
    by (simp add: log_base_conversion)
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_513
  imports Complex_Main
begin




theorem mathd_algebra_513:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5"
    and "a + b = 2" 
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 1"
proof -
  
  have eq1: "3 * a + 2 * b = 5" using assms(1) by simp
  have eq2: "a + b = 2" using assms(2) by simp

  
  have eq2_modified: "2 * (a + b) = 2 * 2" by (simp add: eq2)
  then have "2 * a + 2 * b = 4" by simp

  
  have "3 * a + 2 * b - (2 * a + 2 * b) = 5 - 4" 
    using eq1 `2 * a + 2 * b = 4` by simp
  then have "3 * a - 2 * a = 1" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a = 1" by (simp)

  
  have b_eq: "1 + b = 2" using `a = 1` eq2 by simp
  then have "b = 2 - 1" by (simp)
  then show ?thesis using `a = 1` by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_756
imports Complex_Main 
begin


lemma exponent_base_two:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "2 powr a = 32"
  shows "a = 5"
proof -
  have "2 powr a = 2 powr 5" 
    using assms by auto
  then have "a = 5" 
    using powr_inj[of 2] by fastforce
  thus ?thesis .
qed


lemma exponent_base_five:
  fixes b :: real
  assumes "a = 5" and "5 powr b = 125"
  shows "b = 3"
proof -
  have "5 powr b = 5 powr 3" 
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "b = 3" 
    using powr_inj[of 5] by fastforce
  thus ?thesis .
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_756:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "2 powr a = 32"
    and "a powr b = 125"
  shows "b powr a = 243"
proof -
  
  have a_value: "a = 5" 
    using exponent_base_two[of a] assms(1) by auto

  
  have b_value: "b = 3" 
    using exponent_base_five[of b] a_value assms(2) by auto

  
  have "b powr a = 3 powr 5" 
    using a_value b_value by auto
  
  
  also have "... = 243" by auto
  
  
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_76
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_algebra_76:
  fixes f :: "int \<Rightarrow> int"
  assumes "\<forall>n. odd n \<longrightarrow> f n = n^2"
    and "\<forall> n. even n \<longrightarrow> f n = n^2 - 4*n -1" 
  shows "f(f(f(f(f(4))))) = 1"
proof -
  
  have "f(4) = 4^2 - 4 * 4 - 1" 
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "f(4) = 16 - 16 - 1" by simp
  then have "f(4) = -1" by simp

  
  have "f(-1) = (-1)^2" 
    using assms(1) by auto
  then have "f(-1) = 1" by simp

  
  have "f(1) = 1^2" 
    using assms(1) by auto
  then have "f(1) = 1" by simp

  
  have "f(f(1)) = f(1)" 
    by (simp add: `f(1) = 1`)

  
  have "f(f(f(1))) = f(1)" 
    by (simp add: `f(f(1)) = f(1)`)
  
  have "f(f(f(f(1)))) = f(1)" 
    by (simp add: `f(f(f(1))) = f(1)`)

  have "f(f(f(f(f(4))))) = f(f(f(f(-1))))" 
    by (simp add: `f(4) = -1`)

  have "f(f(f(f(f(4))))) = f(f(f(1)))" 
    by (simp add: `f(-1) = 1`)

  have "f(f(f(f(f(4))))) = f(1)" 
    by (simp add: `f(f(f(f(1))) = f(1)`)

  
  show "f(f(f(f(f(4))))) = 1" 
    by (simp add: `f(1) = 1`)
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_80
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma cross_multiplication:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> -1" 
      and "(x - 9) / (x + 1) = 2"  
  shows "x - 9 = 2 * (x + 1)"
proof -
  have "x - 9 = 2 * (x + 1)" using assms by (simp add: field_simps)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_80:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> -1"
      and "(x - 9) / (x + 1) = 2"
  shows "x = -11"
proof -
  
  
  have eq: "x - 9 = 2 * (x + 1)" using cross_multiplication[of x] assms by auto

  
  
  have expanded_eq: "x - 9 = 2 * x + 2" by (simp add: eq)

  
  
  have rearranged_eq: "-x = 2 + 9" using expanded_eq by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have simplified_eq: "-x = 11" using rearranged_eq by simp

  
  then have "x = -11" using simplified_eq by simp

  
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_100
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Library.Sum_of_Squares"
begin


lemma gcd_lcm_relation:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "gcd a b = g" 
  shows "lcm a b = (a * b) div g"
proof -
  have "gcd a b * lcm a b = a * b" 
    using assms by auto
  then show ?thesis 
    using assms by auto
qed


theorem mathd_numbertheory_100:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "gcd n 40 = 10"
      and "lcm n 40 = 280" 
  shows "n = 70"
proof -
  
  have gcd_n_40: "gcd n 40 = 10" using `gcd n 40 = 10` by simp
  have lcm_n_40: "lcm n 40 = 280" using `lcm n 40 = 280` by simp

  
  have relation: "gcd n 40 * lcm n 40 = n * 40" 
    using gcd_lcm_relation[of n 40] gcd_n_40 lcm_n_40 by simp

  
  have substitution: "10 * 280 = n * 40" using relation by simp

  
  have simplified: "2800 = n * 40" using substitution by simp

  
  have solved: "n = 2800 div 40" using simplified by simp
  then have "n = 70" by simp

  
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_185
  imports Complex_Main 
begin


theorem mathd_numbertheory_185:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n mod 5 = 3" 
  shows "(2 * n) mod 5 = 1"
proof -
  
  obtain k :: nat where nk: "n = 5 * k + 3"
    using assms by (metis mod_eq_iff_eq_add_mult)

  
  have "2 * n = 2 * (5 * k + 3)" 
    using nk by simp

  
  hence "2 * n = 10 * k + 6" by simp

  
  have "(2 * n) mod 5 = (10 * k + 6) mod 5" by simp

  
  also have "... = (0 + 6) mod 5" using mod_mult_eq[of 10 k] by simp

  
  also have "... = 1" by simp

  
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_321
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma multiplicative_inverse:
  fixes a b m :: int
  assumes "a * b mod m = 1"
  shows "\<exists>n. n * b mod m = 1"
proof -
  have "b * (a mod m) mod m = 1"
    using assms by (metis mod_mult_right_eq mult.commute)
  thus ?thesis by (auto simp: field_simps)
qed


theorem mathd_numbertheory_321:
  fixes n::int
  assumes "\<forall>n::int. 1\<le>n \<and> n\<le> 1399 \<and> [n*160 = 1] (mod 1399)"
  shows "n = 1058"
proof -
  
  have "35 * 40 mod 1399 = 1"
    by (simp add: mod_eq_0_iff_dvd)

  
  have "4 * 35 mod 1399 = 1400 mod 1399"
    by (simp add: mod_eq_0_iff_dvd)

  
  have "4 * 1058 mod 1399 = 35"
    using mod_mult_left_eq[of 4 1058 1399] by simp

  
  have "160 * 1058 mod 1399 = (4 * 40) * 1058 mod 1399"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have "4 * (40 * 1058) mod 1399 = 1"
    using multiplicative_inverse[of "40" "35" "1399"] by simp

  
  then show ?thesis
    using \<open>4 * (40 * 1058) mod 1399 = 1\<close> by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_430
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_numbertheory_430:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "1 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 9"
    and "1 \<le> b \<and> b \<le> 9"
    and "1 \<le> c \<and> c \<le> 9"
    and "a \<noteq> b"
    and "a \<noteq> c"
    and "b \<noteq> c"
    and "a + b = c"
    and "10 * a + a - b = 2 * c"
    and "c * b = 10 * a + a + a"
  shows "a + b + c = 8"
proof -
  
  
  have c_eq: "c = a + b" using assms(7) by simp

  
  
  
  have second_eq: "10 * a + a - b = 2 * (a + b)" using c_eq assms(8) by simp

  
  
  have b_eq: "b = 3 * a" using second_eq by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  
  have c_eq_sub: "c = 4 * a" using b_eq c_eq by simp

  
  
  
  have third_eq: "(4 * a) * (3 * a) = 12 * a" using b_eq c_eq_sub assms(9) by simp

  
  have simplified: "12 * a^2 = 12 * a" using third_eq by simp

  
  
  have factor_eq: "a * (a - 1) = 0" using simplified by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have a_val: "a = 1" using assms(1) factor_eq by auto

  
  
  have b_val: "b = 3" using a_val b_eq by simp
  have c_val: "c = 4" using a_val c_eq_sub by simp

  
  have sum: "a + b + c = 1 + 3 + 4" by (simp add: a_val b_val c_val)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_483
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_numbertheory_483:
  fixes a :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
  assumes "a 1 = 1"
    and "a 2 = 1"
    and "\<forall> n. a (n + 2) = a (n + 1) + a n" 
    and "\<forall> n. a n > 0"
  shows "(a 100) mod 4 = 3"
proof -
  
  have "a 1 mod 4 = 1" using assms(1) by simp
  have "a 2 mod 4 = 1" using assms(2) by simp
  have "a 3 = a 2 + a 1" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "a 3 mod 4 = (1 + 1) mod 4" by simp
  then have "a 3 mod 4 = 2" by simp
  
  have "a 4 = a 3 + a 2" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "a 4 mod 4 = (2 + 1) mod 4" by simp
  then have "a 4 mod 4 = 3" by simp

  have "a 5 = a 4 + a 3" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "a 5 mod 4 = (3 + 2) mod 4" by simp
  then have "a 5 mod 4 = 1" by simp
  
  have "a 6 = a 5 + a 4" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "a 6 mod 4 = (1 + 3) mod 4" by simp
  then have "a 6 mod 4 = 0" by simp
  
  have "a 7 = a 6 + a 5" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "a 7 mod 4 = (0 + 1) mod 4" by simp
  then have "a 7 mod 4 = 1" by simp
  
  have "a 8 = a 7 + a 6" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "a 8 mod 4 = (1 + 0) mod 4" by simp
  then have "a 8 mod 4 = 1" by simp
  
  have "a 9 = a 8 + a 7" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "a 9 mod 4 = (1 + 1) mod 4" by simp
  then have "a 9 mod 4 = 2" by simp
  
  have "a 10 = a 9 + a 8" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "a 10 mod 4 = (2 + 1) mod 4" by simp
  then have "a 10 mod 4 = 3" by simp
  
  have "a 11 = a 10 + a 9" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "a 11 mod 4 = (3 + 2) mod 4" by simp
  then have "a 11 mod 4 = 1" by simp
  
  have "a 12 = a 11 + a 10" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "a 12 mod 4 = (1 + 3) mod 4" by simp
  then have "a 12 mod 4 = 0" by simp

  
  
  
  
  have "100 mod 6 = 4" by simp 

  
  then have "a 100 mod 4 = a 4 mod 4" by simp
  then show ?thesis using `a 4 mod 4 = 3` by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_582
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_numbertheory_582:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "0 < n"
    and "3 dvd n"
  shows "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) mod 9 = 0"
proof -
  
  have sum_expr: "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8) = 3 * n + 18)" by simp

  
  obtain k where "n = 3 * k" using assms(2) by (metis dvd_def)

  
  have "3 * n + 18 = 9 * k + 18" using `n = 3 * k` by simp

  
  have "9 * k + 18 = 9 * k + 9 * 2" by simp
  then have "9 * (k + 2) = 9 * (k + 2)" by simp

  
  have "((3 * n + 18) mod 9) = (9 * (k + 2)) mod 9" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

lemma eliminate_c:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b = 11" 
    and "5 * a + b = 111"
  shows "a = 50 \<and> b = -139"
proof -
  have eq1: "3 * a + b = 11" using assms(1) by simp
  have eq2: "5 * a + b = 111" using assms(2) by simp
  have "5 * a + b - (3 * a + b) = 111 - 11" 
    by (simp add: eq1 eq2)
  then have "2 * a = 100" by simp
  have "a = 50" using `2 * a = 100` by (simp add: field_simps)
  have "b = 11 - 3 * a" using eq1 by simp
  then have "b = 11 - 3 * 50" using `a = 50` by simp
  then show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>a = 50\<close>)
qed

lemma system_of_equations:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b = 11" "5 * a + b = 111"
  shows "a = 50" "b = -139"
proof -
  have eq1: "3 * a + b = 11" using assms(1) by simp
  have eq2: "5 * a + b = 111" using assms(2) by simp
  have "5 * a + b - (3 * a + b) = 111 - 11"
    by (simp add: eq1 eq2)
  then have "2 * a = 100" by simp
  have "a = 50" using `2 * a = 100` by (simp add: divide_simps)
  have "b = 11 - 3 * a" using eq1 by simp
  then have "b = 11 - 3 * 50" by (simp add: `a = 50`)
  then show "b = -139" by simp
  show "a = 50" by (simp add: `a = 50`)
qed

lemma substitution_in_equation:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + b + c = 1" and "a = 50" and "b = -139"
  shows "c = 90"
proof -
  have "c = 1 - (a + b)" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "c = 1 - (50 + (-139))" using assms(2) assms(3) by simp
  also have "... = 1 - (50 - 139)" by simp
  also have "... = 1 - (-89)" by simp
  also have "... = 1 + 89" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma substitution_in_equation:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + b + c = 1" "a = 50" "b = -139"
  shows "c = 90"
proof -
  have "c = 1 - (a + b)" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "c = 1 - (50 + (-139))" using assms(2) assms(3) by simp
  also have "... = 1 - (50 - 139)" by simp
  also have "... = 1 - (-89)" by simp
  also have "... = 1 + 89" by simp
  finally show "c = 90" by simp
qed

  assumes "b \<noteq> 0" "a + b * y = c"
  shows "y = (c - a) / b"
proof -
  have "b * y = c - a" 
    using assms(2) by simp
  hence "y = (c - a) / b" 
    using assms(1) by (auto simp: field_simps)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma sum_equations:
  fixes x1 y1 z1 x2 y2 z2 x3 y3 z3 :: real
  assumes "a1 = b1" "a2 = b2" "a3 = b3"
  shows "a1 + a2 + a3 = b1 + b2 + b3"
proof -
  have "a1 + a2 + a3 = b1 + a2 + a3" using assms(1) by simp
  also have "... = b1 + b2 + a3" using assms(2) by simp
  also have "... = b1 + b2 + b3" using assms(3) by simp
  finally show ?thesis .

lemma add_equations:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes eq1: "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and eq2: "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and eq3: "a + b + 3 * c = 19"
  shows "a + b + c = 5"
proof -
  have sum: "(3 * a + b + c) + (a + 3 * b + c) + (a + b + 3 * c) = -3 + 9 + 19"
    using eq1 eq2 eq3 by simp
  have "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25" using sum by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp

lemma solve_linear_system_general:
  fixes n x :: real
  assumes "n + x = a"
      and "n + b * x = c"
      and "b > 1"
  shows "x = (c - a) / (b - 1)"
proof -
  have "n + b * x - (n + x) = c - a" 
    using assms by auto
  then have "(b - 1) * x = c - a" by sos
  then show ?thesis using assms(3) by (auto simp: field_simps)
qed

  shows "a^2 + b^2 \<ge> (a + b)^2 / 2"

  then show ?thesis using assms by (smt (verit) add.commute field_sum_of_halves power2_sum sum_squares_bound)

  shows "a^2 - b^2 = (a - b) * (a + b)"

lemma square_sum_inequality:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a^2 + b^2 = 1"
  shows "a * b \<le> 1/2"

    by (smt (verit) diff_le_eq le_diff_eq power2_sum)
  then have "(a + b)^2 = 1 + 2 * a * b" using assms by simp
  then have "(a + b)^2 \<le> 1 + 2 * (1/2)" using assms
    by sos
  then show "a * b \<le> 1/2" by sos
qed

lemma factorization_properties:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "\<exists> p q. n = p * q"
proof -
  obtain p where "n = p" using assms by (metis nat_0_less_mult_iff)
  then show ?thesis by (metis mult.right_neutral)
qed

lemma inequality_manipulation:
  fixes m n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "m * n <= m + n \<longleftrightarrow> m * (n - 1) <= n"
proof
  show "m * n <= m + n \<Longrightarrow> m * (n - 1) <= n"
  proof -
    assume "m * n <= m + n"
    have "m * n - n <= m" using `m * n <= m + n` by simp
    then have "n * (m - 1) <= m" by (smt (verit) le_trans mult.commute nat_mult_1_right nle_le right_diff_distrib')
    then show "m * (n - 1) <= n" 
      using `n > 0` by (smt (verit) \<open>m * n \<le> m + n\<close> diff_diff_eq diff_is_0_eq nat_mult_1_right right_diff_distrib')
  qed
next
  show "m * (n - 1) <= n \<Longrightarrow> m * n <= m + n"
  proof -
    assume "m * (n - 1) <= n"
    then have "m * n - m <= n" by (smt (verit) le_trans mult.comm_neutral nle_le right_diff_distrib')
    then have "m * n <= m + n" by (simp add: add.commute)
    thus "m * n <= m + n" by simp
  qed
qed

lemma factorization_properties:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "\<exists> p q. n = p * q"
proof -
  obtain p where "p = n" "p > 0"
    using assms by auto
  then have "\<exists> p q. n = p * 1" by auto
  then show ?thesis by (metis mult.right_neutral)
qed

lemma factorial_difference:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) = (n + 1) * fact (n + 1)"
proof -
  have "fact (n + 2) = (n + 2) * fact (n + 1)" by (simp add: fact_Suc)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem amc12b_2020_p6:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0: "9 \<le> n" 
  shows "\<exists>x::nat. (real_of_nat x)^2 = (fact (n + 2) 
              - fact (n + 1)) / fact n"
proof -
  have expression: "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n = (fact (n + 1) * (n + 1)) / fact n"
    using factorial_difference by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have simplified: "fact (n + 1) * (n + 1) / fact n = (n + 1) * (n + 1)"
    using fact_Suc by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "(n + 1) * (n + 1) = (n + 1)^2" by (metis power2_eq_square)
  obtain x where "x = n + 1" by auto
  then show ?thesis 
    using `9 \<le> n` by (metis \<open>(n + 1) * (n + 1) = (n + 1)\<^sup>2\<close> expression of_nat_power simplified)
qed

qed

  fixes n :: nat

lemma sum_first_n_naturals:

next

lemma fraction_subtraction_general:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "b > 0" "d > 0"
  shows "(a / b) - (c / d) = (a * d - c * b) / (b * d)"
proof -
  have "a / b - c / d = a / b - c * (1 / d)" by auto
  then have "(a / b) - (c / d) = a / b - (c * (d / d)) / d" by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2) diff_frac_eq)
qed

lemma reciprocal_sum:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "1 / (a + b) = (1 / a) * (1 / (1 + b / a))"
proof -
  have "1 / (a + b) = 1 / (a * (1 + b / a))" 
    by (smt (verit) add_divide_eq_if_simps(1) add_nonneg_eq_0_iff assms(1) assms(2) divide_cancel_left divide_cancel_right divide_nonneg_pos frac_eq_eq nless_le no_zero_divisors nonzero_divide_mult_cancel_left nonzero_mult_div_cancel_left nonzero_mult_divide_mult_cancel_right2)
  also have "... = (1 / a) * (1 / (1 + b / a))" 
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma reciprocal_inequality:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "1/a + 1/b = (a + b) / (a * b)"
proof -
  have "1/a + 1/b = b/(a*b) + a/(a*b)" by (metis assms(1) assms(2) less_numeral_extra(3) nonzero_divide_mult_cancel_left nonzero_divide_mult_cancel_right)
  then have "1/a + 1/b = (a + b) / (a * b)" by (smt (verit) add.commute add_divide_distrib add_implies_diff add_strict_left_mono assms(1) assms(2) divide_less_cancel divide_strict_right_mono mult_not_zero mult_pos_pos nonzero_divide_mult_cancel_left)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma fraction_simplification:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0" "d \<noteq> 0"
  shows "a / b - c / d = (a * d - c * b) / (b * d)"
proof -
  have "a / b - c / d = a / b + (- c) / d" 
    by simp
  also have "... = (a * d) / (b * d) + (- c * b) / (b * d)"
    by (smt (verit) add.commute add_divide_distrib add_frac_eq assms(1) assms(2) mult.commute)
  finally have "a / b - c / d = (a * d - c * b) / (b * d)"
    by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2) diff_frac_eq)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed
data/full_data/test/induction_1pxpownlt1:
theorem induction_1pxpownlt1pnx:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(1 + n * x) \<le> (1 + x)^n"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by (simp add: power_0)
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "1 + Suc n * x = 1 + n * x + x" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "(1 + x) ^ Suc n = (1 + x) * (1 + x)^n" by simp
  hence "1 + Suc n * x \<le> (1 + x) * (1 + x)^n" 
    by (smt (verit) Bernoulli_inequality assms less_eq_real_def)
  ultimately show ?case by simp
qed

lemma induction_on_inequality:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(\<forall>n. (1 + n * x) \<le> (1 + x)^n)"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by (smt (verit) Bernoulli_inequality assms order_less_imp_le)
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "1 + (Suc n) * x = 1 + n * x + x" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "(1 + x) ^ Suc n = (1 + x) * (1 + x)^n" by simp
  hence "1 + n * x + x \<le> (1 + x) * (1 + x)^n" 
    by (metis Suc calculation power_Suc)
  finally show ?case by (metis Suc)
qed

lemma induction_on_inequality:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(\<forall>n. (1 + n * x) \<le> (1 + x)^n)"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by (smt (verit) Bernoulli_inequality assms order_less_imp_le)
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "1 + Suc n * x = 1 + n * x + x" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = (1 + n * x) + x" by simp
  then have "1 + Suc n * x = (1 + n * x) + x" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "(1 + x)^Suc n = (1 + x) * (1 + x)^n" by simp
  then have "1 + Suc n * x - (1 + x)^Suc n = (1 + n * x) + x - (1 + x) * (1 + x)^n" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "0 < 1 + x" using assms by auto
  have "1 + n * x <= (1 + x)^n" using Suc.IH by auto
  then have "(1 + n * x) + x <= (1 + x) * (1 + x)^n" using `1 + x > 0` by (smt (verit) Suc \<open>(1 + x) ^ Suc n = (1 + x) * (1 + x) ^ n\<close> \<open>1 + real (Suc n) * x = 1 + real n * x + x\<close>)
  thus ?case by (metis Suc)
qed

lemma positive_power:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(1 + x)^n > 0"
proof -
  have "(1 + x) > 0" using assms by linarith
  then show ?thesis
  proof (induction n)
    case 0
    then show ?case by simp
  next
    case (Suc n)
    then show ?case using `1 + x > 0` by auto
  qed
qed

lemma circle_equation_standard_form:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x^2 + 8 * x + y^2 - 6 * y = 0"
  shows "(x + 4)^2 + (y - 3)^2 = 25"
proof -
  have "x^2 + 8 * x = (x + 4)^2 - 16" by sos
  have "y^2 - 6 * y = (y - 3)^2 - 9" by sos
  then have "x^2 + 8 * x + y^2 - 6 * y = (x + 4)^2 - 16 + (y - 3)^2 - 9" 
    using assms by sos
  then have "... = (x + 4)^2 + (y - 3)^2 - 25" by simp
  thus ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>x\<^sup>2 + 8 * x + y\<^sup>2 - 6 * y = (x + 4)\<^sup>2 - 16 + (y - 3)\<^sup>2 - 9\<close> assms)
qed

qed

lemma product_of_squares:

    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  thus ?thesis by (smt (verit) ab_semigroup_mult_class.mult_ac(1) assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) less_eq_real_def mult.commute product_of_pairs_with_conditions real_sqrt_unique zero_less_power)

lemma simplify_sqrt:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a >= 0"
  shows "sqrt (a^2) = a"
proof -
  have "sqrt (a^2) = sqrt (a^2) * sqrt (1)" by auto
  then have "sqrt (a^2) = sqrt (a^2) * (if a = 0 then 0 else 1)"
    using assms by auto
  then have "sqrt (a^2) = a" 
    using assms by auto 
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma simplify_sqrt:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a >= 0"
  shows "sqrt (a^2) = a"
proof -
  have "sqrt (a^2) = a" 
  proof (cases "a = 0")
    case True
    then show ?thesis by simp
  next
    case False
    then have "a > 0" by (metis assms order_less_le)
    then have "a^2 > 0" by auto
    then show ?thesis by (metis assms real_sqrt_unique)
  qed
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

  hence "c = 2 - (a + b)" by simp
  thus ?thesis using eq2 by simp

lemma eliminate_variable:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + b + c = 1"
    and "4*a + 2*b + c = 12"
    and "9*a + 3*b + c = 123"
  shows "3*a + b = 11 \<and> 5*a + b = 111"
proof -
  have eq1: "c = 1 - a - b" using assms(1) by simp
  have eq2: "4*a + 2*b + (1 - a - b) = 12"
    using eq1 assms(2) by simp
  then have "3*a + b = 11" by simp
  have eq3: "9*a + 3*b + (1 - a - b) = 123"
    using eq1 assms(3) by simp
  then have "8*a + 2*b = 122" by simp
  then have "4*a + b = 61" by (simp add: field_simps)
  have "b = 11 - 3*a" using `3*a + b = 11` by simp
  then have "4*a + (11 - 3*a) = 61" by (metis \<open>4 * a + b = 61\<close>)
  then have "a + 11 = 61" by simp
  then have "a = 50" by simp
  have "b = 11 - 3*50" by (metis \<open>a = 50\<close> \<open>b = 11 - 3 * a\<close>)
  then have "b = 11 - 150" by simp
  then have "b = -139" by simp
  have "c = 1 - 50 - (-139)" by (metis \<open>a = 50\<close> \<open>b = - 139\<close> eq1)
  then have "c = 1 - 50 + 139" by simp
  then have "c = 90" by simp
  have "5*a + b = 5*50 - 139" by (simp add: `a = 50` `b = -139`)
  then show ?thesis using `3*a + b = 11` by auto
qed

  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall>x. f x = 5 * x + 4" 
  shows "f 1 = 9"
proof -
  have "f 1 = 5 * 1 + 4" using assms by auto
  also have "... = 5 + 4" by simp
  also have "... = 9" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma function_evaluation:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall>x. f x = 2 * x - 3"
    and "\<forall>x. g x = x + 1"
  shows "g (f 5 - 1) = 7"
proof -
  have "f 5 = 2 * 5 - 3" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "f 5 = 10 - 3" by simp
  then have "f 5 = 7" by simp
  then have "f 5 - 1 = 7 - 1" by simp
  then have "f 5 - 1 = 6" by simp
  then have "g (f 5 - 1) = g 6" by simp
  also have "... = 6 + 1" using assms(2) by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem function_evaluation_composition:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall>x. f x = 2 * x - 3" 
      and "\<forall>x. g x = f x + 4"
  shows "g 5 = 11"
proof -
  have "g 5 = f 5 + 4" using assms(2) by simp
  also have "... = (2 * 5 - 3) + 4" using assms(1) by simp
  finally show "g 5 = 11" by simp
qed

  shows "x = (c - b) / 4"

theorem solve_linear_equation:
  fixes a b c y :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0" "a + b * y = c"
  shows "y = (c - a) / b"
proof -
  have "b * y = c - a" 
    using assms(2) by simp
  hence "y = (c - a) / b" 
    using assms(1) by (auto simp: field_simps)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma solve_linear_system:
  fixes n x :: real
  assumes "n + x = 97"
      and "n + 5 * x = 265"
  shows "x = 42"
proof -
  have "n + 5 * x - (n + x) = 265 - 97" 
    using assms by auto
  then have "4 * x = 168" by simp
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: divide_simps)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_160:
  fixes n x ::real
  assumes "n + x = 97"
      and "n + 5 * x = 265"
  shows "n + 2 * x = 139"
proof -
  have x_value: "x = 42" 
    using solve_linear_system[of n x] assms by auto
  have n_value: "n = 97 - x" 
    using assms(1) x_value by auto
  then have "n = 97 - 42" by (simp add: x_value)
  then have "n = 55" by simp
  have "n + 2 * x = 55 + 2 * 42" 
    using n_value x_value by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma rearrangement_with_floor:
  fixes n k :: nat
  assumes "n + 1000 = 70 * k"
  shows "floor (sqrt n) = floor (sqrt (70 * k - 1000))"
proof -
  have "n = 70 * k - 1000" using assms by simp
  then have "sqrt n = sqrt (70 * k - 1000)" by simp
  thus ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma gcd_lcm_relation:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "0 < a" "0 < b"
  shows "gcd a b * lcm a b = a * b"
proof -
  have "gcd a b > 0" using assms by auto
  hence "lcm a b = (a * b) div (gcd a b)" by (metis lcm_nat_def)
  then have "gcd a b * lcm a b = gcd a b * ((a * b) div (gcd a b))" by simp
  also have "... = a * b" by auto
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_100:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "gcd n 40 = 10"
      and "lcm n 40 = 280" 
  shows "n = 70"
proof -
  have "gcd n 40 * lcm n 40 = n * 40"
    using gcd_lcm_relation[of n 40] assms by fastforce
  then have "10 * 280 = n * 40"
    using assms by simp
  then have "n * 40 = 2800"
    by simp
  then have "n = 2800 div 40"
    by auto
  thus "n = 70"
    by simp
qed

lemma floor_of_multiple:
  fixes n :: real
  assumes "n = 1 / 3"
  shows "floor (10 * n) = 3" and "floor (100 * n) = 33" and "floor (1000 * n) = 333" and "floor (10000 * n) = 3333"
proof -
  have "10 * n = 10 / 3" using assms by simp
  then show "floor (10 * n) = 3" by arith
  have "100 * n = 100 / 3" using assms by simp
  then show "floor (100 * n) = 33" by arith
  have "1000 * n = 1000 / 3" using assms by simp
  then show "floor (1000 * n) = 333" by arith
  have "10000 * n = 10000 / 3" using assms by simp
  then show "floor (10000 * n) = 3333" by arith
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_114:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a = 8" 
  shows "(16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 3)) powr (1 / 3) = 4"
proof -
  have a_squared: "a^2 = 8^2" using assms by simp
  then have "a^2 = 64" by simp
  have cube_root_a_squared: "(a^2) powr (1/3) = 64 powr (1/3)" using a_squared by simp
  then have cube_root_value: "(a^2) powr (1/3) = 4" by (simp add: real_sqrt_unique)
  have expr_value: "16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 3) = 16 * 4" using cube_root_value by simp
  then have expr_value_result: "16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 3) = 64" by simp
  have final_value: "(16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 3)) powr (1 / 3) = 64 powr (1 / 3)" using expr_value_result by simp
  then have result: "(16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 3)) powr (1 / 3) = 4" by (simp add: real_sqrt_unique)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_129:
  fixes  a :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0"
    and "(inverse 8) / (inverse 4) - (inverse a) = 1" 
  shows "a = -2"
proof -
  have eq1: "(inverse 8) / (inverse 4) - (inverse a) = 1" using assms(2) by simp
  have left_side: "(1 / 8) / (1 / 4) - (1 / a) = 1" by (metis eq1 inverse_eq_divide)
  have simplified: "(1 / 8) * (4 / 1) - (1 / a) = 1" by (metis div_by_1 divide_divide_eq_left divide_divide_times_eq divide_real_def eq1 frac_eq_eq inverse_eq_divide mult.commute mult_cancel_right2 nonzero_divide_eq_eq times_divide_times_eq zero_neq_numeral zero_neq_one)
  have fraction_simplified: "1 / 2 - (1 / a) = 1" by (smt (verit) add_divide_eq_if_simps(5) assms(1) diff_add_cancel diff_divide_distrib diff_divide_eq_iff distrib_right divide_divide_times_eq divide_eq_0_iff divide_real_def eq1 eq_divide_imp inverse_diff_inverse inverse_divide inverse_zero_imp_zero left_side nonzero_inverse_eq_divide nonzero_inverse_inverse_eq real_average_minus_first simplified times_divide_times_eq)
  have eq2: "-(1 / a) = 1 - (1 / 2)" by (smt (verit) fraction_simplified)
  have eq3: "-(1 / a) = 1 / 2" by (simp add: eq2)
  have eq4: "1 / a = -1 / 2" by (metis eq3 minus_divide_left verit_minus_simplify(3) verit_minus_simplify(4))
  have a_solution: "a = -2" by (metis dbl_simps(3) eq3 inverse_eq_divide inverse_inverse_eq inverse_minus_eq verit_minus_simplify(4))
  show ?thesis using a_solution by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_107_simplified:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a^2 + 8 * a + b^2 - 6 * b = 0"
  shows "(a + 4)^2 + (b - 3)^2 = 25"
proof -
  have a_square: "a^2 + 8 * a = (a + 4)^2 - 16" 
    by sos
  have b_square: "b^2 - 6 * b = (b - 3)^2 - 9"
    by sos
  have "a^2 + 8 * a + b^2 - 6 * b = 0" 
    using assms by simp
  then have "((a + 4)^2 - 16) + ((b - 3)^2 - 9) = 0" 
    using a_square b_square by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "(a + 4)^2 + (b - 3)^2 - 25 = 0" 
    by (smt (verit) \<open>(a + 4)\<^sup>2 - 16 + ((b - 3)\<^sup>2 - 9) = 0\<close>)
  hence "(a + 4)^2 + (b - 3)^2 = 25" 
    by simp
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_simple:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a = 4" 
  shows "(16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 2)) powr (1 / 2) = 8"
proof -
  have a_squared: "a^2 = 4^2" using assms by simp
  then have "a^2 = 16" by simp
  have square_root_a_squared: "(a^2) powr (1/2) = 16 powr (1/2)" using a_squared by simp
  then have square_root_value: "(a^2) powr (1/2) = 4" by (simp add: real_sqrt_unique)
  have expr_value: "16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 2) = 16 * 4" using square_root_value by simp
  then have expr_value_result: "16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 2) = 64" by simp
  have final_value: "(16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 2)) powr (1 / 2) = 64 powr (1 / 2)" using expr_value_result by simp
  then have result: "(16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 2)) powr (1 / 2) = 8" by (simp add: real_sqrt_unique)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma cal_log_exp_value:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "a ≠ 1" "n > 0"
  shows "log a (a^n) = n"
proof -
  have c0: "log a a = 1"
    by (simp add: assms(1) assms(2))
  have "log a (a^n) = n * (log a a)"
    using log_nat_power[of a a n] by (simp add: assms(1))
  then have c1: "log a (a^n) = n"
    using c0 by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by (simp add: c1)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_209:
  fixes \<sigma>::"real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij \<sigma>"
    and "(Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) 2 = 10"
    and "(Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) 10 = 1"
    and "(Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) 1 = 2" 
  shows "\<sigma> (\<sigma> 10) = 1"
proof -
  have f_10: "\<sigma> 10 = 2"
    using assms(2) by (metis BitM_plus_one assms(1) assms(4) bij_inv_eq_iff semiring_norm(5))
  have f_f_10: "\<sigma> (\<sigma> 10) = \<sigma> 2"
    using f_10 by simp
  have f_2: "\<sigma> 2 = 1"
    using assms(4) by (smt (verit) assms(1) bij_inv_eq_iff)
  have final_result: "\<sigma> (\<sigma> 10) = 1"
    using f_f_10 f_2 by simp
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: final_result)
qed

lemma algebraic_substitution:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a = -1" "b = 5"
  shows "-a - b^2 + 3 * (a * b) = -39"
proof -
  have "b^2 = 5^2" using assms by simp
  then have "b^2 = 25" by auto
  have "a * b = (-1) * 5" using assms by simp
  then have "a * b = -5" by auto
  have "3 * (a * b) = 3 * (-5)" by (simp add: `a * b = -5`)
  then have "3 * (a * b) = -15" by auto
  have "-a = -(-1)" using assms by simp
  then have "-a = 1" by auto
  show "-a - b^2 + 3 * (a * b) = -39"
  proof -
    have "-a - b^2 + 3 * (a * b) = 1 - 25 - 15" 
      using `-a = 1` `b^2 = 25` `3 * (a * b) = -15` by simp
    then show ?thesis by simp
  qed
qed

lemma substitute_and_simplify_with_condition:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "3 * y = x" "2 * x + 5 * y = 11"
  shows "2 * (3 * y) + 5 * y = 11"
  using assms by simp

theorem mathd_algebra_329_with_coefficients:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * b = a" "2 * a + 5 * b = 11"
  shows "a + b = 4"
proof -
  have "2 * a + 5 * b = 11" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "2 * (3 * b) + 5 * b = 11" using substitute_and_simplify_with_condition[of a b] assms(1) by simp
  have "6 * b + 5 * b = 11" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  have "11 * b = 11" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  then have "b = 1" by simp
  have "a = 3 * b" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "a = 3 * 1" using `b = 1` by simp
  hence "a = 3" by simp
  have "a + b = 3 + 1" by (metis \<open>a = 3\<close> \<open>b = 1\<close> add.commute)
  thus "a + b = 4" by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_171_extended:

  assumes "\<forall>x. f x = 5 * x + 4" 
  shows "\<forall>y. f y = 5 * y + 4"
proof -
  have "\<forall>y. f y = 5 * y + 4" using assms by auto
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_412:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x + y = 25"
     and "x - y = 11" 
  shows "x = 18"
proof -
  have "x + y + (x - y) = 25 + 11" 
    using assms by simp
  then have "2 * x = 36" by simp
  have "x = 36 / 2" 
    using `2 * x = 36` by (simp add: divide_simps)
  thus "x = 18" by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_171:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall>x. f x = 5 * x + 4" 
  shows "f 1 = 9"
proof -
  have "f 1 = 5 * 1 + 4" using assms by auto
  also have "... = 5 + 4" by simp
  also have "... = 9" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "b > 0" "c > 0"
  shows "1 / (a + b) = c \<Longrightarrow> a + b = 1 / c"
proof -
  assume "1 / (a + b) = c"

  proof -
    from `c > 0` have "1 / c > 0" by (simp add: field_simps)
    then have "a + b = 1 / c" using `1 / (a + b) = c` by auto
    thus ?thesis by simp
  qed
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem function_composition_multi:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x \<noteq> -2. f x = 1 / (x + 2)"
  shows "f (f (f 1)) = f (3/7)"
proof -
  let ?x = "f 1"
  have "f ?x = 3/7" using assms by auto
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: assms)
qed

lemma function_composition:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x \<noteq> -2. f x = 1 / (x + 2)"
  shows "f (f 1) = 3/7"
proof -
  have "f 1 = 1 / (1 + 2)" using assms by auto
  then have "f 1 = 1 / 3" by simp
  then have "f (f 1) = f (1/3)" using assms by (simp add: `f 1 = 1 / 3`)
  also have "... = 1 / (1/3 + 2)" using assms by auto
  also have "... = 1 / (1/3 + 6/3)" by simp
  also have "... = 1 / (7/3)" by simp
  also have "... = 3/7" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"
proof -

    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"
    using assms(4) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma express_ratio:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0" "y = (2/5) * x" "z = (7/10) * y"
  shows "z / x = (7 / 25)" and "y / x = (2 / 5)"
proof -
  have "z = (7 / 10) * y" using assms(3) by simp
  then have "z = (7 / 10) * ((2 / 5) * x)" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "z = (7 * 2 / 50) * x" by simp
  then have "z = (14 / 50) * x" by simp
  then have "z = (7 / 25) * x" by simp
  then show "z / x = (7 / 25)" using assms(1) by (simp add: field_simps)
  show "y / x = (2 / 5)" using assms(2) by (metis assms(1) divide_numeral_1 frac_eq_eq mult.commute mult_numeral_1_right times_divide_eq_left zero_neq_numeral)
qed

lemma express_ratio_in_terms:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0" "2 * x = 5 * y" "7 * y = 10 * z"
  shows "z = (7 / 25) * x"
proof -
  have "y = (2 / 5) * x" using assms(2) by (simp add: field_simps)  
  then have "z = (7 / 10) * y" using assms(3) by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "z = (7 / 10) * ((2 / 5) * x)" by (simp add: `y = (2 / 5) * x`)
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

qed

lemma express_z_in_terms_of_x_and_y:

  assumes "2 * x = 5 * y" and "7 * y = 10 * z"

qed

lemma eliminate_variable:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a + b + c = 1"
    and "4*a + 2*b + c = 12"
    and "9*a + 3*b + c = 123"
  shows "3*a + b = 11 \<and> 5*a + b = 111"
proof -
  have eq1: "c = 1 - a - b" using assms(1) by simp
  have eq2: "4*a + 2*b + (1 - a - b) = 12"
    using eq1 assms(2) by simp
  then have "3*a + b = 11" by simp
  have eq3: "9*a + 3*b + (1 - a - b) = 123"
    using eq1 assms(3) by simp
  then have "8*a + 2*b = 122" by simp
  then have "4*a + b = 61" by (simp add: field_simps)
  have "b = 11 - 3*a" using `3*a + b = 11` by simp
  then have "4*a + (11 - 3*a) = 61" by (metis \<open>4 * a + b = 61\<close>)
  then have "a + 11 = 61" by simp
  then have "a = 50" by simp
  have "b = 11 - 3*50" by (metis \<open>a = 50\<close> \<open>b = 11 - 3 * a\<close>)
  then have "b = 11 - 150" by simp
  then have "b = -139" by simp
  have "c = 1 - 50 - (-139)" by (metis \<open>a = 50\<close> \<open>b = - 139\<close> eq1)
  then have "c = 1 - 50 + 139" by simp
  then have "c = 90" by simp
  have "5*a + b = 5*50 - 139" by (simp add: `a = 50` `b = -139`)
  then show ?thesis using `3*a + b = 11` by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_398:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c"
    and "9 * b = 20 * c"
    and "7 * a = 4 * b"
  shows "63 * a = 80 * c"
proof -
  have b_expr: "b = (20 / 9) * c"
    using assms(2) by (simp add: field_simps)
  have "7 * a = 4 * ((20 / 9) * c)"
    using b_expr assms(3) by auto
  then have "7 * a = (80 / 9) * c" 
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  have "a = (80 / 63) * c"
    using `7 * a = (80 / 9) * c` by (simp add: field_simps)
  have "63 * a = 63 * ((80 / 63) * c)"
    by (simp add: `a = (80 / 63) * c`)
  then have "63 * a = 80 * c" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma function_evaluation:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall>x. f x = 2 * x - 3"
    and "\<forall>x. g x = x + 1"
  shows "g (f 5 - 1) = 7"
proof -
  have "f 5 = 2 * 5 - 3" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "f 5 = 10 - 3" by simp
  then have "f 5 = 7" by simp
  then have "f 5 - 1 = 7 - 1" by simp
  then have "f 5 - 1 = 6" by simp
  then have "g (f 5 - 1) = g 6" by simp
  also have "... = 6 + 1" using assms(2) by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_412_extended:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "x + y + z = 25"
     and "x - y + z = 11" 
  shows "x = 18 - z"
proof -
  have "x + y + z + (x - y + z) = 25 + 11"
    using assms by simp
  then have "2 * x + 2 * z = 36" by simp
  have "2 * x = 36 - 2 * z" 
    using `2 * x + 2 * z = 36` by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "x = (36 - 2 * z) / 2" 
    using `2 * x = 36 - 2 * z` by (simp add: divide_simps)
  thus "x = 18 - z" by simp
qed

  then show ?thesis by (simp add: divide_simps)
qed

  fixes x y :: real

    using `2 * x = a + b` by (simp add: divide_simps)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma algebraic_substitution:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a = -1" "b = 5"
  shows "-a - b^2 + 3 * (a * b) = -39"
proof -
  have "b^2 = 5^2" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "b^2 = 25" by simp
  have "a * b = (-1) * 5" using assms(1) assms(2) by simp
  then have "a * b = -5" by simp
  have "3 * (a * b) = 3 * (-5)" by (metis \<open>a * b = - 5\<close>)
  then have "3 * (a * b) = -15" by simp
  have "-a = -(-1)" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "-a = 1" by simp
  have "-a - b^2 + 3 * (a * b) = 1 - 25 - 15" by (smt (verit) \<open>3 * (a * b) = - 15\<close> \<open>b\<^sup>2 = 25\<close> assms(1))
  also have "... = 1 - 40" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma algebraic_substitution:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a = -1" "b = 5"
  shows "-a - b^2 + 3 * (a * b) = -39"
proof -
  have "b^2 = 5^2" using assms by simp
  then have "b^2 = 25" by auto
  have "a * b = (-1) * 5" using assms by simp
  then have "a * b = -5" by auto
  have "3 * (a * b) = 3 * (-5)" by (simp add: `a * b = -5`)
  then have "3 * (a * b) = -15" by auto
  have "-a = -(-1)" using assms by simp
  then have "-a = 1" by auto
  show "-a - b^2 + 3 * (a * b) = -39"
  proof -
    have "-a - b^2 + 3 * (a * b) = 1 - 25 - 15" 
      using `-a = 1` `b^2 = 25` `3 * (a * b) = -15` by simp
    then show ?thesis by simp
  qed
qed

  assumes "x >= 0" "y >= 0"
  shows "(x - y)^2 >= 0"
proof -

  thus ?thesis by (simp add: assms)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_329:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "3 * y = x"
    and "2 * x + 5 * y = 11" 
  shows "x + y = 4"
proof -
  have "2 * x + 5 * y = 11" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "2 * (3 * y) + 5 * y = 11" using substitute_and_simplify[of x y] assms(1) by simp
  have "6 * y + 5 * y = 11" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  have "11 * y = 11" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  then have "y = 1" by simp
  have "x = 3 * y" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "x = 3 * 1" using `y = 1` by simp
  hence "x = 3" by simp
  have "x + y = 3 + 1" by (metis \<open>x = 3\<close> \<open>y = 1\<close> add.commute)
  thus "x + y = 4" by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_412_extended:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "x + y + z = 25"
     and "x - y + z = 11" 
  shows "x = 18 - z"
proof -
  have "x + y + z + (x - y + z) = 25 + 11" 
    using assms by simp
  then have "2 * x + 2 * z = 36" by simp
  have "2 * (x + z) = 36" by (smt (verit) \<open>2 * x + 2 * z = 36\<close>)
  have "x + z = 18" 
    using `2 * (x + z) = 36` by (simp add: divide_simps)
  thus "x = 18 - z" by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_412_extended:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "x + y + z = 25"
     and "x - y + z = 11" 
  shows "x = 18 - z"
proof -
  have "x + y + z + (x - y + z) = 25 + 11"
    using assms by simp
  then have "2 * x + 2 * z = 36" by simp
  have "2 * x = 36 - 2 * z" 
    using `2 * x + 2 * z = 36` by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "x = (36 - 2 * z) / 2" 
    using `2 * x = 36 - 2 * z` by (simp add: divide_simps)
  thus "x = 18 - z" by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_302_extended:
  fixes z :: complex
  assumes "z = \<i> / 2"
  shows "z^2 = -(1 / 4)"
proof -
  have "z^2 = (\<i> / 2)^2" using assms by blast
  also have "... = (\<i>^2) / (2^2)" by (simp add: power_divide)

lemma mod_add_power:

  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"

    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"
    using assms(4) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_388:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "3 * x + 4 * y - 12 * z = 10"
      and "-2 * x - 3 * y + 9 * z = -4"
    shows "x = 14"
proof -
  let ?w = "y - 3 * z"
  have eq1: "3 * x + 4 * (?w + 3 * z) - 12 * z = 10"
    using assms(1) by simp
  then have "3 * x + 4 * ?w = 10" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have eq2: "-2 * x - 3 * (?w + 3 * z) + 9 * z = -4"
    using assms(2) by simp
  then have "-2 * x - 3 * ?w = -4" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "4 * ?w = 10 - 3 * x" by (smt (verit) assms(1))
  then have "?w = (10 - 3 * x) / 4" by (simp add: divide_simps)
  have "-2 * x - 3 * ((10 - 3 * x) / 4) = -4" 
    using `-2 * x - 3 * ?w = -4` by (metis \<open>y - 3 * z = (10 - 3 * x) / 4\<close>)
  have "-8 * x - 3 * (10 - 3 * x) = -16" 
    by (smt (verit) \<open>- 2 * x - 3 * ((10 - 3 * x) / 4) = - 4\<close> \<open>- 2 * x - 3 * (y - 3 * z) = - 4\<close> \<open>4 * (y - 3 * z) = 10 - 3 * x\<close>)
  have "-8 * x - 30 + 9 * x = -16" by (smt (verit) \<open>- 8 * x - 3 * (10 - 3 * x) = - 16\<close>)
  then have "x - 30 = -16" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "x = 14" by (simp add: add_eq_0_iff)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_172:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall>x. f x = 5 * x + 4" 
  shows "f (x + 1) = f x + 5"
proof -
  have "f (x + 1) = 5 * (x + 1) + 4" using assms by auto
  also have "... = 5 * x + 5 + 4" by simp
  also have "... = (5 * x + 4) + 5" by (simp add: distrib_right)
  also have "... = f x + 5" using assms by auto
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_143:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = x + 1"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x^2 + 3" 
  shows "f (g 2) = 8"
proof -
  have g_eval: "g 2 = 2^2 + 3" using assms(2) by auto
  have g_result: "g 2 = 4 + 3" using g_eval by simp
  then have g_value: "g 2 = 7" by simp
  have f_eval: "f (g 2) = f 7" using g_value by simp
  also have "... = 7 + 1" using assms(1) by auto
  also have "... = 8" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

data/full_data/test/mathd_algebra_513.js:
theorem mathd_algebra_338:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and "a + b + 3 * c = 19" 
  shows "a * b * c = -56"
proof -
  have eq1: "3 * a + b + c = -3" using assms(1) by simp
  have eq2: "a + 3 * b + c = 9" using assms(2) by simp
  have eq3: "a + b + 3 * c = 19" using assms(3) by simp
  have sum_eq: "(3 * a + b + c) + (a + 3 * b + c) + (a + b + 3 * c) = -3 + 9 + 19"
    by (simp add: eq1 eq2 eq3)
  have simplified_sum: "5 * (a + b + c) = 25"
    by (smt (verit) eq1 eq2 eq3)
  have sum_abc: "a + b + c = 5"
    using simplified_sum by (simp add: divide_simps)
  have a_eq: "2 * a = -8" 
    using eq1 sum_abc by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "a = -4" by simp
  have b_eq: "2 * b = 4" 
    using eq2 sum_abc by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "b = 2" by simp
  have c_eq: "2 * c = 14" 
    using eq3 sum_abc by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "c = 7" by simp
  have product: "a * b * c = (-4) * 2 * 7"
    using `a = -4` `b = 2` `c = 7` by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_107_simplified:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a^2 + 8 * a + b^2 - 6 * b = 0"
  shows "(a + 4)^2 + (b - 3)^2 = 25"
proof -
  have a_square: "a^2 + 8 * a = (a + 4)^2 - 16" 
    by sos
  have b_square: "b^2 - 6 * b = (b - 3)^2 - 9"
    by sos
  have "a^2 + 8 * a + b^2 - 6 * b = 0" 
    using assms by simp
  then have "((a + 4)^2 - 16) + ((b - 3)^2 - 9) = 0" 
    using a_square b_square by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "(a + 4)^2 + (b - 3)^2 - 25 = 0" 
    by (smt (verit) \<open>(a + 4)\<^sup>2 - 16 + ((b - 3)\<^sup>2 - 9) = 0\<close>)
  hence "(a + 4)^2 + (b - 3)^2 = 25" 
    by simp
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma add_equations:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes eq1: "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and eq2: "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and eq3: "a + b + 3 * c = 19"
  shows "a + b + c = 5"
proof -
  have sum: "(3 * a + b + c) + (a + 3 * b + c) + (a + b + 3 * c) = -3 + 9 + 19"
    using eq1 eq2 eq3 by simp
  have "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25" using sum by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma substitute_and_simplify_with_condition:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "3 * y = x" "2 * x + 5 * y = 11"
  shows "2 * (3 * y) + 5 * y = 11"
  using assms by simp

theorem mathd_algebra_329_with_coefficients:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * b = a" "2 * a + 5 * b = 11"
  shows "a + b = 4"
proof -
  have "2 * a + 5 * b = 11" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "2 * (3 * b) + 5 * b = 11" using substitute_and_simplify_with_condition[of a b] assms(1) by simp
  have "6 * b + 5 * b = 11" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  have "11 * b = 11" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  then have "b = 1" by simp
  have "a = 3 * b" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "a = 3 * 1" using `b = 1` by simp
  hence "a = 3" by simp
  have "a + b = 3 + 1" by (metis \<open>a = 3\<close> \<open>b = 1\<close> add.commute)
  thus "a + b = 4" by simp
qed

lemma gcd_lcm_relation:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "0 < a" "0 < b"
  shows "gcd a b * lcm a b = a * b"
proof -
  have "gcd a b > 0" using assms by auto
  hence "lcm a b = (a * b) div (gcd a b)" by (metis lcm_nat_def)
  then have "gcd a b * lcm a b = gcd a b * ((a * b) div (gcd a b))" by simp
  also have "... = a * b" by auto
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma gcd_lcm_relation:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "gcd a b * lcm a b = a * b"
  using assms by auto

lemma gcd_lcm_example:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "gcd n 40 = 10" "lcm n 40 = 280"
  shows "n = 70"
proof -
  have "gcd n 40 * lcm n 40 = n * 40"
    by auto
  then have "10 * 280 = n * 40"
    using assms by simp
  then have "2800 = n * 40"
    by simp
  then have "n = 2800 div 40"
    by auto
  thus "n = 70"
    by simp
qed

lemma gcd_lcm_example:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "gcd n 40 = 10" and "lcm n 40 = 280"
  shows "n = 70"
proof -
  have "gcd n 40 * lcm n 40 = n * 40"
    by auto
  also have "... = 10 * 280" 
    using assms by (metis calculation)
  finally have "n * 40 = 10 * 280" 
    by simp
  then have "n * 40 = 2800" 
    by simp
  thus "n = 70" 
    using `n * 40 = 2800` by auto
qed

lemma mod_simplification_extended:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "b > 0"
  shows "a mod b = a - (a div b) * b"
  by (metis modulo_nat_def assms)

lemma mod_addition:
  fixes a b m :: nat
  assumes "m > 0"
  shows "(a + b) mod m = ((a mod m) + (b mod m)) mod m"
proof -
  have "a + b = (a mod m) + (b mod m) + (a div m + b div m) * m"
    using mod_simplification_extended[of a m] mod_simplification_extended[of b m] 
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: mod_simplification_extended)
qed

lemma mod_multiply:
  fixes a b n m :: nat
  assumes "a mod m = b"
  shows "(c * a) mod m = (c * b) mod m"
  using assms by (metis mod_mult_cong mod_mult_left_eq mult.commute)

lemma mod_simplification:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "b > 0"
  shows "(a + b) mod b = a mod b"
proof -
  have "a + b = (a mod b) + (a div b) * b + b"
    by auto
  then have "(a + b) mod b = ((a mod b) + (a div b) * b + b) mod b"
    by simp
  also have "... = (a mod b) + ((a div b) * b mod b) mod b"
    by auto
  also have "... = (a mod b) + 0"
    using assms by auto
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mod_addition:
  fixes a b m :: nat
  assumes "m > 0"
  shows "(a + b) mod m = ((a mod m) + (b mod m)) mod m"
proof -
  have "a + b = (a mod m) + (b mod m) + (a div m) * m + (b div m) * m"
    using assms by auto
  thus ?thesis by presburger
qed

lemma integer_residue_properties:
  fixes a b c m :: int
  assumes "a mod m = b"
  shows "(c * a) mod m = (c * b) mod m"
proof -
  have "a = b + m * (a div m)" using assms by auto
  then have "c * a = c * (b + m * (a div m))" by simp
  then have "c * a = c * b + c * m * (a div m)" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "(c * a) mod m = (c * b + c * m * (a div m)) mod m" by simp
  also have "... = (c * b) mod m" 
  proof -
    have "(c * m * (a div m)) mod m = 0" by (simp add: assms)
    then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>a = b + m * (a div m)\<close> ab_semigroup_mult_class.mult_ac(1) add.commute assms bits_mod_0 eq_iff_diff_eq_0 minus_mod_eq_mult_div mod_0 mod_add_cong mod_diff_cong mod_mult_cong mod_mult_self4 mult.commute mult_zero_right verit_sum_simplify)
  qed
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mod_multiply:
  fixes a b c m :: nat
  assumes "a mod m = b"
  shows "(c * a) mod m = (c * b) mod m"
proof (cases "m = 0")
  case True
  then show ?thesis by (metis assms mod_by_0 mult_delta_right)
next
  case False
  then have "m > 0" by simp
  have "c * a = c * (b + m * (a div m))"
    using assms by auto
  then have "(c * a) mod m = (c * (b + m * (a div m))) mod m"
    by auto
  also have "... = ((c * b) + (c * m * (a div m))) mod m"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (c * b) mod m"
  proof -
    have "c * m * (a div m) mod m = 0" 
      using `m > 0` by auto
    thus ?thesis by (metis ab_semigroup_mult_class.mult_ac(1) add_0_iff mod_add_cong mod_mult_right_eq mod_mult_self1_is_0 mult.commute mult_delta_right)
  qed
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mod_multiplicative_inverse:
  fixes a b n :: nat
  assumes "a * b mod n = 1"
  shows "b * a mod n = 1"
  by (metis assms mult.commute)

lemma mod_mult_inverse:
  fixes a b m :: int
  assumes "gcd a m = 1"
  shows "(a * b) mod m = 1 \<longleftrightarrow> (b * a) mod m = 1"
proof -
  have "a * b mod m = 1 \<longleftrightarrow> (a * b) mod m = 1" by simp
  moreover have "(b * a) mod m = (a * b) mod m" by (simp add: mult.commute)
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp
qed

  assumes "0 < a" "0 < b" "0 < c"
    and "9 * b = 20 * c"

  shows "63 * a = 80 * c"

theorem mathd_algebra_398:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c"
    and "9 * b = 20 * c"
    and "7 * a = 4 * b"
  shows "63 * a = 80 * c"
proof -
  have b_expr: "b = (20 / 9) * c"
    using assms(2) by (simp add: field_simps)

    using b_expr assms(3) by auto
  then have "7 * a = (80 / 9) * c" 
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  have "a = (80 / 63) * c"
    using `7 * a = (80 / 9) * c` by (simp add: field_simps)
  have "63 * a = 63 * ((80 / 63) * c)"
    by (simp add: `a = (80 / 63) * c`)
  then have "63 * a = 80 * c" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma substitute_and_simplify_with_condition:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "3 * y = x" "2 * x + 5 * y = 11"
  shows "2 * (3 * y) + 5 * y = 11"
  using assms by simp

theorem mathd_algebra_329_with_coefficients:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * b = a" "2 * a + 5 * b = 11"
  shows "a + b = 4"
proof -
  have "2 * a + 5 * b = 11" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "2 * (3 * b) + 5 * b = 11" using substitute_and_simplify_with_condition[of a b] assms(1) by simp
  have "6 * b + 5 * b = 11" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  have "11 * b = 11" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2))
  then have "b = 1" by simp
  have "a = 3 * b" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "a = 3 * 1" using `b = 1` by simp
  hence "a = 3" by simp
  have "a + b = 3 + 1" by (metis \<open>a = 3\<close> \<open>b = 1\<close> add.commute)
  thus "a + b = 4" by simp
qed

lemma mod_product_multiple:
  fixes a b :: nat and n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "(a * b) mod n = ((a mod n) * (b mod n)) mod n"
proof -
  have "(a * b) mod n = ((a mod n) * (b mod n)) mod n"
    by (metis mod_mod_trivial mod_mult_cong mod_mult_eq mult.commute)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma sum_expression_mod:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) mod m = (3 * n + 18) mod m"
proof -
  have "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) = n + 4 + n + 6 + n + 8" by simp
  also have "... = 3 * n + (4 + 6 + 8)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 3 * n + 18" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_582:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "0 < n"
    and "3 dvd n"
  shows "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) mod 9 = 0"
proof -
  have sum_eq: "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) mod 9 = (3 * n + 18) mod 9" 
    using sum_expression_mod by simp
  obtain k where "n = 3 * k" using assms(2) by (auto simp: dvd_def)
  have substituted: "(3 * n + 18) mod 9 = (3 * (3 * k) + 18) mod 9" 
    using `n = 3 * k` by simp
  then have "(3 * n + 18) mod 9 = (9 * k + 18) mod 9" by simp
  have "(9 * k + 18) mod 9 = 0" by simp
  then show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>(3 * n + 18) mod 9 = (9 * k + 18) mod 9\<close> sum_eq)
qed

lemma sum_expression:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) = 3 * n + 18"
proof -
  have "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) = n + 4 + n + 6 + n + 8" by simp
  also have "... = 3 * n + (4 + 6 + 8)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 3 * n + 18" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_582:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "0 < n"
    and "3 dvd n"
  shows "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) mod 9 = 0"
proof -
  have sum_eq: "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) = 3 * n + 18" 
    using sum_expression by simp
  obtain k where "n = 3 * k" using assms(2) by (auto simp: dvd_def)
  have substituted: "3 * n + 18 = 3 * (3 * k) + 18" 
    using `n = 3 * k` by simp
  then have "3 * n + 18 = 9 * k + 18" by simp
  have "9 * k + 18 = 9 * (k + 2)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "9 * (k + 2) mod 9 = 0" by simp
  then show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>3 * n + 18 = 9 * k + 18\<close> \<open>9 * k + 18 = 9 * (k + 2)\<close> sum_eq)
qed

lemma mod_sum:
  fixes a b n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "(a + b) mod n = (a mod n + b mod n) mod n"
proof -
  have "(a + b) mod n = ((a mod n) + (b mod n)) mod n"
    by (metis mod_mod_trivial mod_add_cong)
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: assms(1))
qed

lemma solve_linear_system:
  fixes n x :: real
  assumes "n + x = 97"
      and "n + 5 * x = 265"
  shows "x = 42"
proof -
  have "n + 5 * x - (n + x) = 265 - 97" 
    using assms by auto
  then have "4 * x = 168" by simp
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: divide_simps)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_160:
  fixes n x ::real
  assumes "n + x = 97"
      and "n + 5 * x = 265"
  shows "n + 2 * x = 139"
proof -
  have x_value: "x = 42" 
    using solve_linear_system[of n x] assms by auto
  have n_value: "n = 97 - x" 
    using assms(1) x_value by auto
  then have "n = 97 - 42" by (simp add: x_value)
  then have "n = 55" by simp
  have "n + 2 * x = 55 + 2 * 42" 
    using n_value x_value by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma alternating_sum_with_conditions:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 5"
  shows "2 - 0 + n - 7 = n - 5"
  using assms by simp

lemma alternating_sum_generalized:
  fixes n k :: nat
  shows "k - 0 + n - (2*k + 5) = n - (k + 5)"
proof -
  have "k - 0 + n - (2*k + 5) = n - k - 5" 
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma alternating_sum_special_case:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "2 - 0 + n - 7 = n - 5"
  by (simp add: alternating_sum_generalized[of 2 n])

lemma factorial_difference:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) = (n + 1) * fact (n + 1)"
proof -
  have "fact (n + 2) = (n + 2) * fact (n + 1)" by (simp add: fact_Suc)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem amc12b_2020_p6:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0: "9 \<le> n" 
  shows "\<exists>x::nat. (real_of_nat x)^2 = (fact (n + 2) 
              - fact (n + 1)) / fact n"
proof -
  have expression: "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n = (fact (n + 1) * (n + 1)) / fact n"
    using factorial_difference by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have simplified: "fact (n + 1) * (n + 1) / fact n = (n + 1) * (n + 1)"
    using fact_Suc by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "(n + 1) * (n + 1) = (n + 1)^2" by (metis power2_eq_square)
  obtain x where "x = n + 1" by auto
  then show ?thesis 
    using `9 \<le> n` by (metis \<open>(n + 1) * (n + 1) = (n + 1)\<^sup>2\<close> expression of_nat_power simplified)
qed

```isabelle
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem aime_1989_p8:
  fixes a b c d e f g :: real
  assumes "a + 4 * b + 9 * c + 16 * d + 25 * e + 36 * f + 49 * g = 1"
    and "4 * a + 9 * b + 16 * c + 25 * d + 36 * e + 49 * f + 64 * g = 12"
    and "9 * a + 16 * b + 25 * c + 36 * d + 49 * e + 64 * f + 81 * g = 123" 
  shows "16 * a + 25 * b + 36 * c + 49 * d + 64 * e + 81 * f + 100 * g = 334"
proof -
  
  have eq1: "a + 4 * b + 9 * c + 16 * d + 25 * e + 36 * f + 49 * g = 1" using assms(1) by simp
  have eq2: "4 * a + 9 * b + 16 * c + 25 * d + 36 * e + 49 * f + 64 * g = 12" using assms(2) by simp
  have eq3: "9 * a + 16 * b + 25 * c + 36 * d + 49 * e + 64 * f + 81 * g = 123" using assms(3) by simp

  
  have "4 * a + 9 * b + 16 * c + 25 * d + 36 * e + 49 * f + 64 * g - (a + 4 * b + 9 * c + 16 * d + 25 * e + 36 * f + 49 * g) = 12 - 1"
    using eq1 eq2 by simp
  then have "3 * a + 5 * b + 7 * c + 9 * d + 11 * e + 13 * f + 15 * g = 11" by simp

  have "9 * a + 16 * b + 25 * c + 36 * d + 49 * e + 64 * f + 81 * g - (4 * a + 9 * b + 16 * c + 25 * d + 36 * e + 49 * f + 64 * g) = 123 - 12"
    using eq2 eq3 by simp
  then have "5 * a + 7 * b + 9 * c + 11 * d + 13 * e + 15 * f + 17 * g = 111" by simp

  
  let ?x1 = "a" 
  let ?x2 = "b"
  let ?x3 = "c"
  let ?x4 = "d"
  let ?x5 = "e"
  let ?x6 = "f"
  let ?x7 = "g"

  
  have eq4: "3 * ?x1 + 5 * ?x2 + 7 * ?x3 + 9 * ?x4 + 11 * ?x5 + 13 * ?x6 + 15 * ?x7 = 11"
  and eq5: "5 * ?x1 + 7 * ?x2 + 9 * ?x3 + 11 * ?x4 + 13 * ?x5 + 15 * ?x6 + 17 * ?x7 = 111"
    by (simp_all add: `3 * a + 5 * b + 7 * c + 9 * d + 11 * e + 13 * f + 15 * g = 11`
                      `5 * a + 7 * b + 9 * c + 11 * d + 13 * e + 15 * f + 17 * g = 111`)

  
  have "2 * ?x1 + 2 * ?x2 + 2 * ?x3 + 2 * ?x4 + 2 * ?x5 + 2 * ?x6 + 2 * ?x7 = 100"
    using eq4 eq5 by simp
  then have "2 * (?x1 + ?x2 + ?x3 + ?x4 + ?x5 + ?x6 + ?x7) = 100"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "?x1 + ?x2 + ?x3 + ?x4 + ?x5 + ?x6 + ?x7 = 50" by (simp add: field_simps)

  
  have "?x2 = (11 - 3 * ?x1 - 7 * ?x3 - 9 * ?x4 - 11 * ?x5 - 13 * ?x6 - 15 * ?x7) / 5"
    using eq4 by simp

  
  have final_value: "16 * ?x1 + 25 * ?x2 + 36 * ?x3 + 49 * ?x4 + 64 * ?x5 + 81 * ?x6 + 100 * ?x7 = 334" 
  proof -
    
    show "16 * ?x1 + 25 * ?x2 + 36 * ?x3 + 49 * ?x4 + 64 * ?x5 + 81 * ?x6 + 100 * ?x7 = 334"
      by (simp add: `?x1 + ?x2 + ?x3 + ?x4 + ?x5 + ?x6 + ?x7 = 50`) 
  qed

  
  show ?thesis using final_value by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory algebra_2varlineareq_fp3zeq11_3tfm1m5zeqn68_feqn10_zeq7
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem algebra_2varlineareq_fp3zeq11_3tfm1m5zeqn68_feqn10_zeq7:
  fixes f z::complex
  assumes h0: "f + 3*z = 11"
      and h1: "3*(f - 1) - 5*z = -68" 
    shows "f = -10 \<and> z = 7"
proof -
  
  have f_eq: "f = 11 - 3*z" using h0 by simp

  
  have eq_substituted: "3 * ((11 - 3*z) - 1) - 5*z = -68"
    using f_eq h1 by simp

  
  have simplified_eq: "3 * (10 - 3*z) - 5*z = -68"
    using eq_substituted by simp

  
  have expanded_eq: "30 - 9*z - 5*z = -68"
    using simplified_eq by simp

  
  have combined_terms: "30 - 14*z = -68"
    using expanded_eq by simp

  
  have "14*z = 30 + 68" using combined_terms by simp
  then have "14*z = 98" by simp

  
  have "z = 98 / 14" using `14*z = 98` by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "z = 7" by simp

  
  have f_value: "f = 11 - 3*7" using f_eq `z = 7` by simp
  then have "f = 11 - 21" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory algebra_sqineq_at2malt1
  imports Complex_Main
begin




theorem algebra_sqineq_at2malt1:
  fixes a::real 
  shows "a * (2 - a) \<le> 1"
proof -
  
  have "a * (2 - a) = 2 * a - a^2" by simp

  
  then have "2 * a - a^2 - 1 \<le> 0" by simp

  
  have "-(a^2 - 2 * a + 1) \<le> 0" by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have "(a - 1)^2 = a^2 - 2 * a + 1" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)

  
  have "(a - 1)^2 \<ge> 0" by (simp add: square_nonneg)

  
  thus ?thesis using `-(a^2 - 2 * a + 1) \<le> 0` by simp
qed
```

```isabelle
theory algebra_sqineq_unitcircatbpabsamblt1
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem algebra_sqineq_unitcircatbpabsamblt1:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes h0: "a^2 + b^2 = 1" 
  shows "a * b + \<bar>a - b\<bar> \<le> 1"
proof -
  
  
  
  
  
  have "a * b + \<bar>a - b\<bar> = a * b + (if a ≥ b then a - b else b - a)"
    by (simp add: abs_if)

  
  moreover
  {
    assume "a ≥ b"
    have "a * b + (a - b) ≤ 1"
      
      
    proof -
      have "a * b + (a - b) = a + a * b - b" by simp
      also have "... ≤ 1" 
      proof -
        
        have "b^2 = 1 - a^2" using assms by simp
        then show "a + a * b - b ≤ 1" by (smt (verit, best) add.commute le_add_same_cancel2)
      qed
      finally show ?thesis .
    qed
  }

  
  moreover
  {
    assume "b ≥ a"
    have "a * b + (b - a) ≤ 1"
      
    proof -
      have "a * b + (b - a) = b + a * b - a" by simp
      also have "... ≤ 1" 
      proof -
        have "a^2 = 1 - b^2" using assms by simp
        then show "b + a * b - a ≤ 1" by (smt (verit, best) add.commute le_add_same_cancel2)
      qed
      finally show ?thesis .
    qed
  }
  ultimately show ?thesis by auto
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theorem amc12a_2002_p6:
  fixes n :: nat 
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "\<exists> m > n. \<exists> p. m * p \<le> m + p"
proof -
  
  obtain m where "m = n + 1" by auto

  
  let ?p = 1

  
  have "m * ?p = m * 1" by simp
  also have "... = m" by simp
  also have "m + ?p = m + 1" by simp
  then have "m * ?p <= m + ?p" if "m = n + 1" for m using that by simp

  
  
  show ?thesis
    using `m = n + 1` by auto
qed
```

```isabelle
theory amc12a_2009_p6
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem amc12a_2009_p6:
  fixes m n p q :: real
  assumes  "p = 2 powr m"
    and "q = 3 powr n"
  shows "p powr (2 * n) * (q powr m) = 12 powr (m * n)"
proof -
  
  have "12 powr (m * n) = (2^2 * 3^1) powr (m * n)" by (simp add: power_mult)

  
  also have "... = (2^2) powr (m * n) * (3^1) powr (m * n)" by (metis power_mult)

  
  also have "... = 2 powr (2 * m * n) * 3 powr (m * n)" by (metis power_exponentiation)

  
  also have "... = (2 powr m) powr (2 * n) * (3 powr n) powr m" by (metis power_of_power)

  
  finally have "12 powr (m * n) = p powr (2 * n) * q powr m" by (metis assms)

  
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem amc12a_2021_p3:
  fixes x y :: nat
 assumes h0: "x + y = 17402"
   and h1: "10 dvd x"
   and h2: "x div 10 = y" 
 shows "x - y = 14238"
proof -
  
  have "x = 10 * (x div 10)" using h1 by (metis dvd_def)
  
  
  have "10 * (x div 10) + (x div 10) = 17402" using h0 h2 by simp
  
  
  then have "11 * (x div 10) = 17402" by simp
  
  
  have "x div 10 = 17402 div 11" by (simp add: div_mult_self2)
  then have "x div 10 = 1582" by simp
  
  
  have "x = 10 * (x div 10)" using `x div 10 = 1582` by simp
  then have "x = 10 * 1582" by simp
  then have "x = 15820" by simp
  
  
  have "y = x div 10" using h2 by simp
  then have "y = 1582" by (simp add: `x = 15820`)
  
  
  have "x - y = 15820 - 1582" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp 
qed
```

```isabelle
theory amc12b_2020_p6
  imports Complex_Main 
begin


lemma factorial_difference:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) = (n + 1) * fact (n + 1)"
proof -
  
  have "fact (n + 2) = (n + 2) * fact (n + 1)" by (simp add: fact_Suc)
  
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed


theorem amc12b_2020_p6:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0: "9 \<le> n" 
  shows "\<exists>x::nat. (real_of_nat x)^2 = (fact (n + 2) 
              - fact (n + 1)) / fact n"
proof -
  
  have expression: "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n = (fact (n + 1) * (n + 1)) / fact n"
    
    using factorial_difference by simp
  
  
  have simplified: "fact (n + 1) * (n + 1) / fact n = (n + 1) * (n + 1)"
    using fact_Suc by simp

  
  have "(n + 1) * (n + 1) = (n + 1)^2" by simp

  
  obtain x where "x = n + 1" by auto
  then show ?thesis 
    using `9 ≤ n` by auto
qed

end
```
